title: CRM & Marketing Automation Specialist (GoHighLevel + Content Support)
description:
About Us:



We are a nurse-owned hospice company in Arizona focused on compassionate care, strong community relationships, and growth through systems and education. We are building a structured CRM inside GoHighLevel to track referrals, automate follow-ups, and strengthen referral partner relationships.



We are also building a video and podcast presence to educate the community and drive traffic to our website and YouTube channel.



We are looking for a long-term team member who can grow with us.



Phase 1: CRM Build-Out (Immediate Focus)



Your first priority will be to:



• Set up GoHighLevel CRM from scratch

• Build 3 main pipelines (Referral Intake, Referral Partner, Bereavement)

• Import and organize contacts

• Tag contacts correctly

• Create task templates the owner can assign quickly

• Build automation workflows (SMS +
 follow-ups)

• Connect website forms to CRM

• Ensure clean structure and reporting

• Document simple SOPs



We are building:

• Referral tracking system

• Google lead response automation

• Drip campaigns for referral partners

• Bereavement follow-up sequence



Phase 2: Content & Brand Growth Support (Long-Term)



Once CRM is structured and running smoothly, your responsibilities will expand to:



• Edit short-form video clips (Reels, TikTok, Shorts)

• Edit 30-minute mini podcast episodes

• Add captions and subtitles

• Create SEO-optimized titles and descriptions

• Upload and schedule content across platforms

• Optimize YouTube metadata

• Repurpose long-form content into short clips

• Help drive traffic back to our website



Required Skills:



• GoHighLevel experience (must explain what you’ve built)

• CRM workflow creation

• Marketing automation logic

• Tagging & segmentation strategy

• Strong written English

• Basic video editing (CapCut, Descript, Premiere, etc.)

• Understanding of SEO for YouTube and social media



Ideal Candidate:



• Thinks in systems, not just tasks

• Organized and detail-oriented

• Can suggest improvements

• Understands marketing funnels

• Comfortable with automation tools

• Interested in long-term growth



Hours & Compensation:



• 15–20 hours per week to start

• Potential long-term growth

• Flexible schedule

• Please include hourly rate



To Apply:



Please answer:



Describe a CRM you have built from scratch.



What automations have you created in GoHighLevel?



How would you structure a referral pipeline for a healthcare business?



What video editing tools do you use?



Explain how you optimize YouTube titles and descriptions for SEO.



Include the word “Engine” at the top of your application.

title: TikTok Shop Executive Assistant
description:
Mission For TikTok Shop Executive Assistant



To track tangible results and identify revenue generating creators for TikTok Shop brands by:

Finding creators’ TikTok usernames from their Discord handles

Creating creator campaigns on Growi and inputting creators’ Tiktok handles

Sorting through Discord server members to identify top-performing TikTok Shop creators

Reaching out to creators to be a part of 7-day posting cohorts

Handling additional weekly tasks that are assigned

Outputs // KPIs:

Track results and identify revenue generating creators

You’ll achieve this through these primary methods:

Finding creators’ TikTok usernames from their Discord handles

We host weekly coaching calls on Discord for each of our brands. We will give you a list of creators who attended each and you will find their TikTok handles.

Creating creator campaigns on Growi and inputting creators’ Tiktok handles

Using a creator tracking software called Growi, you will create a separate campaign for each coaching Call. Then, you’ll add each creator who joined the respective call to the campaign using their handle you found earlier.

Sorting through Discord server members to identify top-performing TikTok Shop creators

In all of our brand’s Discord servers, we implement a ticket system that allows us to maintain 1 on 1 communication with all the top creators. 

You will sort through all the members who join the Discord, find out their TikTok handle, and check their L30 day gmv on the TikTok Affiliate Center.

This is vital because it allows us to communicate with as many high potential creators as possible and maximize the number of videos they post.

Reaching out to creators to be a part of 7-day posting cohorts

We host 7 day posting cohorts where we take a group of 5 creators with potential to generate sales, put them in a group chat, and provide one video every day for them to replicate.

You will be in charge of identifying creators to be a part of these posting cohorts. Once you identify top performing TT Shop creators, you’re going to message them privately, asking if they want to be a part of the cohort.

Handling additional weekly tasks that are assigned

Turn new priorities from meetings, Slack, and ad?hoc requests into completed tasks with clear owners, deadlines, and visible progress. Ensure nothing falls through the cracks. 

Daily execution of team & administrative tasks

In addition to coaching the creators and maintaining these relationships, you will have a minimal amount of administrative tasks.

Daily Check-Ins:

Provide updates on what tasks you’ve been working on that day.

Report findings of what’s working and what isn’t.

Share ideas for improving client success.

End of Day Report

At the end of each work day, you will be expected to complete a form outlining everything you completed for that day.

Weekly Team Meeting

Attend team check-in meeting via Google Meet every week.



Competencies:

Proficient in English 

Part of your job will require you to outreach hundreds of creators. You must be able to write clear, friendly DMs and hold a proper conversation with creators as needed. 

Communication and responsiveness

You are active on Slack and respond to messages timely.

High ownership and bias to action

You don’t wait for instructions on what to complete each day. You take action relentlessly and own the operations you’re in charge of.

Whenever there’s a new batch of creators that join a brand’s Discord, you immediately begin looking them up on TikTok without me reminding you to.

Every week, there will be new tasks to handle. Upon hearing them, you will immediately spring to action and complete them as soon as possible.

Disciplined

A majority of your job will be manual work, but you’ll manage it at the highest quality. 

You follow instructions exactly, document what you’ve completed every day, and don’t skip steps.

Organized

You will be in charge of tracking hundreds or even thousands of creators. You’re on top of all the work you’re completing, ensuring that you have the proper systems in place to deliver the highest quality possible. 

TikTok Shop Experience

You have experience operating within TikTok Shop Seller Center, Tiktok Shop Affiliate Center, and using tools like Growi. 

You have a deep understanding of how to navigate through these platforms and look up creators usernames to find their L30 Day GMV.





Executive Assistant Position Description:

Time

You will have the freedom to make your own schedule. That said, it is crucial that you have access to the necessary tools (Slack) to handle replies during work hours

You will be expected to complete your end of day tasks every day Monday-Friday.

You will also be expected to be online M-F from 8am - 5pm EST: replying to creator messages and communicating through slack.

This position is remote, so you will have the freedom to work from anywhere. Please ensure that you have a strong connection and there are minimal distractions when on calls with clients.

Compensation

$1000/mo full time

Potential for added bonuses depending on performance



Please film a 5 minute max loom explaining:

1. Previous experience you've had with TikTok Shop - brands you've worked with, results you've driven, etc. Only people with TikTok Shop experience will be considered.

2. Why you are a good fit for the position.

3. How to find a creators' last 30 day gmv generated. Share your screen and show yourself walking through this.

title: Social Media Assistant (Instagram Focus)
description:
Hi! I'm Dr. Lauren — a mom of 3 and family wellness chiropractor in the western suburbs of Chicago. My patients always want to know more about me so I'm launching my personal brand as an extension of Rooted Chiropractic, a practice focused on pregnancy, moms, babies, and kids. I share real life: motherhood, low-tox living, and everyday wellness. The content is clean, warm, and elevated — never salesy. The goal is genuine connection that naturally draws the right people to our community and clinic.



I'm looking for a creative, detail-oriented VA to help bring this content to life consistently on Instagram. This starts part-time with room to grow into a larger role for the right person.





What You'll Be Doing

Edit Instagram Reels from raw iPhone footage — clean cuts, text overlays, on-brand audio

Design carousel posts and story graphics in Canva

Write captions that match my voice (warm, real, educational — I'll guide you)

Schedule and publish content; maintain a consistent posting cadence

Organize content files and help maintain a simple content calendar

I will provide raw video, content ideas, and ongoing direction and feedback.





Skills & Tools Required

Reels editing experience — CapCut, InShot, or similar

Canva — proficient and fast, with a clean, simple design style

Strong written English — grammar, tone, and natural-sounding captions

Scheduling tools — Later, Planoly, or Meta Business Suite

Clean, calm aesthetic — not flashy or trendy





You're a Great Fit If...

You're organized, detail-oriented, and meet deadlines without reminders

You can write in someone else's voice and make it feel authentic

You're genuinely interested in health, wellness, or family content

You're looking for a long-term role and want to grow with a brand

You work independently — you don't need constant direction to produce great work



Growth Opportunity

This role can expand into content planning, strategy support, additional platforms, and more hours over time. I'm looking for someone who wants to build something with me — not just check boxes.





How to Apply

Please include:

A brief intro — who you are and why this role interests you

2–3 examples of Instagram content you've created (links or screenshots)

A sample Canva graphic or mock post in a clean, wellness-inspired style (optional but will help you stand out)

Your availability

Applications without portfolio examples will not be reviewed

title: Reddit Assistant
description:
We’re hiring people to manage daily activity on Reddit, including posting content and interacting within communities. This is ongoing work and requires someone who actually understands how Reddit functions, not just how to scroll it.



You’ll need at least one smartphone (Android or iOS both are fine). If you own multiple devices, that’s a plus and allows you to earn more. Expect roughly one hour of work per device each day.



Each day you’ll post content across several subreddits.



A critical part of this role is reading the room. The videos we provide can range from humorous to emotional to awkward or uncomfortable. You need to instantly recognize the tone and write posts that feel natural for that type of content. If you post everything the same way, you’ll fail.



You’ll also be responsible for finding appropriate subreddits for each video. That means reviewing community rules, understanding what performs well there, and making sure your post doesn’t look forced or out of place. If you can’t do that consistently, this position isn’t for you.



We’re looking for people who think independently, adapt fast, and don’t need their hand held. Prior Reddit experience is helpful but not mandatory if you learn quickly.



This is a long-term opportunity for dependable workers. Compensation is solid and can increase based on results and how many devices you use.



Earnings:

Most contributors earn $250–$500 per month, depending on consistency and the number of devices used.



Time Commitment:

Daily time commitment ranges from about 1 to 5 hours, depending on how many devices you’re using



To apply, include:

• how many devices you can work with

• your experience using Reddit

• when you’re available each day

title: Historical Story Hunter
description:
The Mission

We are looking for a Historical Story Hunter. This is not a typical virtual assistant role; it is a mission to dig through the "vaults" of time and unearth the strange, the tragic, and the unexplained. We are building a massive digital library of forgotten history, and we need a hunter who can track down original newspaper clippings from the 1800s and 1900s.



You will be responsible for stocking our "Content Bucket" months in advance. Your work will provide the raw, authentic evidence that makes history come alive for our global audience.



Your Daily Hunt

Your focus is volume, discovery, and organization. Your goal is to find 5–10 high-quality stories every day to fill our comprehensive library across US, UK, and Australian archives.



You will be hunting across these genres:



The Unexplained: Strange Sightings, Ancient/Forbidden Technology, Mass Panic/Hysteria.



The Tragic: Disasters & Catastrophes, Emotional/Aviation A
, Lost Expeditions.



The Mysterious: Maritime Mysteries, Unsolved Disappearances, Crimes & Scandals.



The Odd: Newspaper Oddities (strange 19th-century reports) and Australian Bushranger stories.



The Calendar: Building an "On This Day" Library that covers every day of the year.



The Hunter’s Toolkit (Daily Tasks)

Search the Archives: Use global digital vaults to find stories from a provided lead list.



Capture the Evidence: 

Save the full newspaper page (high-res PDF/Image).

Capture 5 targeted screenshots (The headline, the key paragraphs, the byline, and any sketches/photos).

Document the Facts: Create a simple text file for every story including: Publication Name, Date, Full Headline, Source URL, and a 1–3 sentence factual summary (Quite often a copy paste of data already on the page).

Organize the Vault: File everything into a structured Google Drive "Bucket" categorized by decade and theme for easy retrieval months later.



The Selection Challenge: Prove You’re a Hunter

We don’t want a resume; we want proof of your hunting skills. Please complete these four short tasks (Total time: ~15 minutes). Simply provide the screenshots and answers requested in your application.



Task 1: The End of an Outlaw (Trove - Australia)

The Source: 

The Goal: Open this report on the execution of the bushranger Ned Kelly.

What to send: A screenshot of the article. In your reply, tell me what his very last words were according to this specific report.



Task 2: The Capture at Glenrowan (Trove - Australia)

The Source: 

The Goal: Find the original news of Ned Kelly’s capture (the siege at Glenrowan), not his execution.

Search Tip: Focus your search on late June or early July 1880.

What to send: A screenshot of a report from that week (June 28 – July 5, 1880) showing the newspaper name and date.



Task 3: The Mary Celeste Mystery (Chronicling America - USA)

The Source: 

The Goal: Find a report on the "Ghost Ship" Mary Celeste published between December 1872 and June 1873.

Search Tip: Look for a detailed report from late February or early March 1873.

What to send: A screenshot of the newspaper scan showing the mention of the ship and the date.



Task 4: Your Instincts

The Goal: Based on the genre list in the "Daily Hunt" section above, tell me which genre of historical stories interests you the most and why?



Requirements

Precision: You can find exact dates and clean clippings.

Archival Quality: Your screenshots are clear, straight, and professional.

Independence: You love the thrill of the hunt and don't need hand-holding.

Reliable Setup: Stable internet and a computer capable of handling high-res images/PDFs.



How to Apply

Reply with a summary of why you are interested in this job along with the screenshots/answers from Tasks 1–4. 



All candidates will be considered, the taskings is for you to see if this is something you will enjoy doing and for me to see what kind of outputs you can produce. 



No prior archive experience? No problem. If you have a sharp eye for detail, a passion for the past, and strong English skills, we will help you to become a Master Hunter. Don't be shy :) 



This position is listed as 40 hours per week however it is open to part time and full time applicant. Pay reviews will be conducted every 3-6 months. 



Happy Hunting!

title: Short?Form Video Editor (Real Estate) – Remote
description:
1. Role Overview

We’re looking for a fully remote Short?Form Video Editor who can move fast, think in hooks, and deliver clean edits under pressure. You’ll turn our real estate footage into scroll?stopping content for agents and builders, from the story idea and opening hook all the way through to final export.



This role is open to both gig?based and full?time, and it’s a strong way to stand out if you want to specialize in real estate and brand?driven storytelling.



2. About SH Films

SH Films is a real estate media company that helps agents and builders market properties and projects with high?impact video. We focus on listing walk?throughs, agent branding pieces, and builder process videos that show a home’s journey from dirt to finished product.



We work with professionals who care about their brand, speed, and quality. That means we value editors who can hit deadlines, communicate clearly, and still protect the quality of the final image.



3. What You’ll Own

You are responsible for turning raw real estate footage into short?form videos that agents and builders can’t wait to post.



You will:



Edit short?form videos (15–90 seconds) for Reels, TikTok, and Shorts from property tours, branding shoots, and builder content.



Develop or refine pre?production concepts: simple story arcs, shot lists, and edit structures that make each property or brand feel intentional.



Write or improve hooks and on?screen text that grab attention in the first few seconds and keep viewers engaged.



Create multiple cuts from a single shoot (hero edit plus several supporting clips).



Add captioning, callouts, and simple motion graphics that highlight features, benefits, and brand messages.



Ensure consistent color, sound, pacing, and branding across edits.



Work with tight deadlines and “rush” projects while staying organized and calm.



Communicate clearly about timelines, questions, and potential issues so we never miss a delivery.



4. What Success Looks Like

After 60–90 days, success looks like:



You can take a brief, reference examples, and footage and turn them into strong edits with minimal back?and?forth.



You consistently hit fast turnaround times (often 24–72 hours per project, depending on scope).



You perform well under pressure when multiple projects land at once, keeping communication clear and expectations realistic.



Your hooks and story structures increase watch time and engagement on client content.



Agents and builders start asking for you by name and referencing your previous edits as the standard.



5. Day?to?Day

A typical week might include:



Receiving several projects with clear deadlines and simple creative direction.



Reviewing footage, identifying the best visuals and sound bites, and mapping a short story arc for each edit.



Writing or refining hooks, on?screen text, and CTA frames that feel natural for real estate.



Editing for multiple aspect ratios, with an emphasis on vertical content.



Delivering final files, plus occasionally alternate versions (shorter cut, different hook, text/no text).



Handling last?minute or rush edits when a client needs something turned around quickly (e.g., before a listing goes live).



6. Requirements

Must?haves

Proven track record editing short?form video (Reels, TikTok, Shorts) with a portfolio or reel.



Experience crafting story ideas, hooks, and structures that keep people watching, not just cutting clips together.



Ability to work quickly and accurately, with short turnaround times and firm deadlines.



Demonstrated ability to stay calm and professional under pressure.



Proficiency in a professional editing tool (Premiere Pro, Final Cut, or DaVinci Resolve).



Strong sense of pacing, music, and visual flow.



Reliable internet and setup for fully remote work.



Strong communication skills and responsiveness in a remote environment.



Nice?to?haves

Experience with real estate, architecture, or lifestyle content.



Basic motion graphics skills (titles, callouts, simple transitions).



Familiarity with current trends and best practices for property content on social platforms.



7. Who You Are

You might be a great fit if:



You think like a storyteller first and an editor second: you care about the hook, the arc, and the payoff.



You enjoy working fast and feel comfortable with deadlines and occasional last?minute requests.



You’re organized with your timelines, folders, and exports, even when juggling multiple projects.



You want your work to actually ship and be seen daily, not sit in drafts.



You like the idea of growing into more work (or full?time) as you prove reliability and quality.



8. Role Logistics

title: Senior Financial Modeling and Analysis Specialist
description:
Job Description: Senior Financial Modeling & Analysis Specialist

Location: Remote (Philippines)

Work Schedule: [EST/Business Hours]

Employment Type: Full-time



About the Role

We are looking for a high-caliber Financial Modeling expert to join our consulting team. This is not a "back-office" data entry role; you will be the architect of the financial tools our clients use to make multi-million dollar decisions. You will bridge the gap between complex data and strategic insights, building robust, audit-ready models from scratch.



Key Responsibilities

• Model Architecture: Design, build, and maintain complex financial models (DCF, LBO, 3-Statement, Merger Models, and Budgeting/Forecasting tools) in Excel.

• Client Advisory: Interface directly with clients to gather requirements, present findings, and explain model assumptions and sensitivities.

• Scenario Analysis: Perform "what-if" analyses and stress testing to evaluate potential business outcomes and risks.

• Data Integrity: Audit existing client models to identify errors, improve efficiency, and implement best practices in spreadsheet design (e.g., FAST Standard).

• Reporting: Translate model outputs into executive-level PowerPoint presentations and dashboards.



Required Qualifications

• Education: Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or a related field. CPA or CFA (Level II or III) highly preferred.

• Experience: 5+ years of experience in financial modeling, investment banking, corporate FP&A, or management consulting.

• Technical Mastery: Advanced Excel skills (Power Query, VBA/Macros, complex nested formulas). Familiarity with Power BI or Tableau is a plus.

• Communication: Exceptional English verbal and written communication skills—capable of explaining technical financial concepts to non-finance stakeholders.

• Attention to Detail: An uncompromising commitment to accuracy and "zero-error" deliverables.



Compensation & Benefits

Competitive Salary. pay out every every 16th and 1st. 

Benefits: 13th-month pay

Leave: 8 days Holiday Leave plus 12 VL/SL (1 credit accrual per month).

Other benefits: to be provided upon hire

title: AI Music Producer
description:
Job Posting: AI Audio Producer & VA (Suno Specialist)

Role Overview

We are looking for a fast-paced, detail-oriented AI Audio Producer to create custom "Walk-Up Songs" for our brand and clients. You aren't just hitting "Generate"; you are an architect of sound who can take a reference track and replicate its energy, tempo, and vibe using Suno AI while customizing lyrics for a professional, high-end output.



Key Responsibilities

Reference Matching: Analyze a reference song’s "DNA" (BPM, genre, instrumentation, mood) and replicate that sound as closely as possible using advanced Suno prompting.



Lyric Architecture: Structure custom lyrics specifically for Suno’s engine. You must know how to use Metatags ([Drop], [Heavy Bass], [Staccato]) to ensure the brand name or hook hits with maximum impact.



Phonetic Tuning: Edit and "cheat" lyrics (using phonetic spelling) to ensure the AI pronounces brand names and client names perfectly every time.



Rapid Delivery: Turn around 2–3 high-quality variations based on a client brief within a short window.



Post-Production Polish: Basic mastering of the Suno output (EQ, leveling, and trimming) to ensure the song sounds professional over speakers or in social media content.



Technical Requirements

Mastery of Suno AI: Deep knowledge of V3.5/V4, including the "Upload Audio" reference feature and style-prompting.



Lyric Flow Knowledge: Ability to count syllables and write lyrics that fit a specific rhythm—avoiding "clunky" or "crowded" AI vocals.



DAW Proficiency: Experience with Audacity, FL Studio, Logic, or similar to trim the "Gold 30 Seconds" and normalize audio levels.



Quality Control: An ear for "AI hallucinations" (static, slurred words, or off-beat rhythms) and the discipline to discard subpar generations.



Preferred Qualifications

Experience in Sports Production or Event DJing.



Ability to isolate stems (vocals/instrumentals) for cleaner mixing.

title: Shopify Store Builder, GMC Compliant
description:
WELLBALANCE SL is a fast-growing e-commerce company operating multiple Shopify stores across Europe and North America. We focus on building scalable, compliant, and structured online stores designed for long-term stability and sustainable growth.



To support our expansion, we are looking for a highly precise Shopify Store Setup Specialist whose sole responsibility is building new Shopify stores from scratch. This role is focused on structure, accuracy, and compliance — not marketing, CRO, or creative work.



Tasks

 • Build Shopify stores from scratch using predefined templates, SOPs, and checklists

 • Set up store structure, pages, navigation, policies, and backend settings strictly according to internal guidelines

 • Ensure each store is fully compliant with Google Merchant Center policies

 • Prepare stores to be approval-ready for Google Merchant Center with no missing requirements

 • Follow SOPs precisely and document completion for each store

 • Perform detailed quality checks before internal handover

 • Build 2–3 Shopify stores per week while maintaining consistent quality and structure



Requirements

 • Proven experience building Shopify stores from scratch

 • Strong knowledge of Shopify backend: settings, pages, navigation, policies, and store structure

 • Experience with Google Merchant Center compliance and requirements

 • Highly detail-oriented with a precision-driven mindset

 • Naturally perfectionistic and attentive to small details

 • Ability to follow templates, SOPs, and checklists without deviation

 • Fast execution while maintaining accuracy and consistency

 • Ability to deliver error-free work at scale





Benefits

 • Fully remote position

 • Long-term collaboration with a fast-scaling e-commerce company

 • Clear processes, templates, and expectations

 • Competitive compensation based on experience and output





How to Apply



Interested candidates should apply with:

 • Their resume

 • A short explanation of why structured and precise work suits them

 • Examples of Google Merchant Center–compliant Shopify stores built from scratch



If you enjoy building Shopify stores by the book, with precision and consistency, this role is for you.

title: Remote Dental Admin & Recall Coordinator
description:
We are a growing private dental and aesthetic clinic in Surrey, UK, looking for a long-term, full-time virtual assistant with strong dental admin experience to own our day-to-day back-office and recall workflows. You will work closely with the clinic owner and an external UK-based virtual reception team, focusing on Dentally, data accuracy and keeping patients fully followed up. 



Open to full time or part time. If part time, there needs to be room to expand into full time if workload requires it.



ABOUT THE ROLE



This is a fully remote role (home-based) supporting a UK time zone, typically Monday–Friday (flexible on working hours as long as majority is within UK hours). You will not handle live phone calls; instead, you will be the "engine room" behind the scenes, managing Dentally, patient records, recalls and admin tasks so the clinical and reception teams can focus on patients.



This role requires someone who can work proactively and independently in the background. You will need to be highly comfortable with data, CRM systems, and creating reports. A key part of your role is managing upwards – regularly communicating with clinicians and the reception team through clear reports and task lists, highlighting what needs attention and ensuring nothing falls through the cracks.



Key responsibilities



DENTALLY & PATIENT DATA MANAGEMENT: 



- Log in to Dentally daily to review new patients and updates, checking that all new registrations are complete and accurate.

- Check that new patient enquiries have been added correctly, have appointments booked, and have received their treatment plans and information.

- Maintain excellent data hygiene: tidy records, consistent contact details, correct tags, accurate medical/dental history status (where provided by the clinic).

- Create and manage tasks in Dentally for the reception team and clinicians (e.g. "call to rebook," "awaiting X-ray," "send estimate").

- Build and maintain custom reports from Dentally data to support decision-making and identify trends or gaps.





RECALLS, RACTIVATION AND FOLLOW-UP



- Run recall and reactivation reports (exams, hygiene, and other key treatments) on an agreed schedule (e.g. daily/weekly).

- Build and maintain structured recall lists (due, overdue, lapsed) and keep them up to date as patients book, cancel or decline.

- Prepare daily call/WhatsApp lists for our UK reception partner, including notes and priority flags so they can efficiently contact patients.

- Send recall and reminder messages 
/SMS/WhatsApp templates) directly where appropriate and log all communication in Dentally.

- Track and record recall outcomes (booked, no answer, wrong number, declined, to contact later) to keep lists accurate and actionable.





NEW PATIENT JOURNEY & TREATMENT PLAN TRACKING



- Monitor new patient enquiries and consultations: check who has attended, who needs follow-up and who has not yet booked the next step.

- Track treatment plans (e.g. Invisalign, cosmetic, restorative) to see which are accepted, pending or inactive, and create follow-up tasks or lists.

- Work with the virtual reception team by providing updated lists of patients needing follow-up calls or
s, and reconciling outcomes back into Dentally.

-
 regular task lists and priority updates to clinicians and the reception team, clearly outlining outstanding patient actions required.



INBOX AND GENERAL ADMIN SUPPORT



- Manage the main reception/admin
 inbox and WhatsApp alongside the UK team: organise, triage, and respond to routine admin queries (receipts, invoices, forms, directions, basic information).

- Create tasks from
s and WhatsApp for the clinical or reception team where a follow-up is needed, and chase until completed.

- Produce simple reports or summaries of activity (e.g. weekly recall progress, outstanding treatment plans, key admin tasks completed).





FINANCE AND EXPENSES (BASIC LEVEL) 



- Support with simple billing and admin: checking that invoices have been generated, payments recorded, and outstanding balances flagged in Dentally.

- Assist with logging and organising clinic expenses and documentation in agreed spreadsheets or systems (training provided).





PERFORMANCE REPORTING & PRACTICE ANALYTICS



You will be responsible for extracting and reporting on key performance metrics from Dentally on a monthly basis to support practice growth and clinician performance management.



MONTHLY REPORTS WILL INCLUDE: 



- Revenue generated – total practice revenue and breakdown by clinician/practitioner

- Case acceptance rates – percentage of treatment plans accepted vs presented, by clinician

- Hygiene conversion rates – for dentists who refer to hygiene, track conversion from referral to booked hygiene appointment

- Treatment conversion – track enquiry-to-consultation and consultation-to-treatment conversion rates

- Diary efficiency – monitor appointment utilisation, cancellations, DNAs (did not attend), and gaps in schedules by clinician

- Patient retention – track active vs lapsed patients, recall compliance rates, and patient churn



You will prepare clear, digestible monthly performance summaries and
 these to the clinic owner and relevant clinicians, highlighting trends, successes and areas for improvement.





COMPLIANCE & CONTINOUS IMPROVEMENT:



- Help keep administrative aspects of compliance (e.g. CQC-related logs/checklists) organised and up to date as directed by the practice manager.

- Proactively suggest improvements to processes, templates, and workflows that can make the clinic run more smoothly and efficiently.





ABOUT YOU / ESSENTIAL EXPERIENCE:



- Minimum 2-3 years of experience in dental administration, dental reception or a similar role within a dental practice (onsite or remote).

- Hands-on experience using a dental practice management system (Dentally, Dentrix, Open Dental, Software of Excellence, etc.). Dentally-specific training will be provided, but you must already be confident working in a patient CRM/EHR.

Strong understanding of day-to-day dental practice workflows: new patient journeys, recalls, treatment plans, cancellations, and how a busy diary runs.

- Experience pulling reports, working with data and creating summaries or dashboards from practice management systems.



SKILLS & ATTRIBUTES



- Highly organised, detail-focused and comfortable working with reports, lists and spreadsheets.

- Comfortable with data analysis and creating performance reports – you understand what metrics matter and can present them clearly.

- Strong communication skills for managing upwards: you regularly update clinicians and teams via
 with clear task lists, reports and priority actions.

- Proactive: you notice gaps (e.g. patients not rebooked, recalls not sent, missing data) and act on them without waiting to be asked.

- Confident written English for patient
s, internal notes and professional reports.

- Tech-savvy, comfortable learning new tools and working in a cloud-based environment with stable internet and backup power.

- Reliable, discreet and comfortable handling confidential medical and financial information.





TRAINING AND SUPPORT 



You will receive:



- Induction training on our clinic workflows, Dentally setup and recall protocols.

- Guidance on which performance metrics to track and how to extract and format monthly reports.

- Ongoing support from the clinic owner and project manager, plus close collaboration with our UK virtual reception partner.



If this sounds like you, please apply with your CV and a short message describing your dental admin experience, which practice management systems you've used, and any experience you have creating reports or working with practice data.

 Ads and Google Ads preferred

*Experience in healthcare marketing (e.g. dental, allied health, or other professional practices) is highly preferred.

title: Technical SEO Specialist (Webflow + Weglot Expert) - Long Term
description:
We are Danthree Studio, a high-end CGI agency for the furniture & tech industry. We are an SEO-first agency and rely heavily on organic traffic for our B2B leads. We are looking for a Technical SEO & AI Search Specialist to join our team.



?? READ CAREFULLY: We need a Code-Level Technical Expert, not a Content Writer or Generalist.



We work with a specific stack: Webflow + Weglot (International SEO). You must understand how they interact technically (Canonicals, Hreflang, Sitemaps).



YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES:

• Monitor Ahrefs Site Health and fix technical errors (Redirects, 404s, Canonicals).

• Create and implement custom JSON-LD Schema Markup (using 
 method, nesting Product/Service correctly).

• Implement GEO Strategies: Optimize our content and technical structure for AI Search Engines (ChatGPT Search, Google AI Overviews, Perplexity).

• Manage International SEO tags for our languages (DE, EN, FR, IT).

• Optimize technical performance (Core Web Vitals) in Webflow.



REQUIREMENTS:

1. Deep experience with Webflow CMS & SEO Settings.

2. Experience with Weglot (Subdirectories) and debugging Hreflang tags.

3. Ability to write/edit JSON-LD Schema manually (not just using plugins).

4. Proficient with Ahrefs, Screaming Frog, and GSC.

5. Semantic SEO / GEO Knowledge: You understand Entities, Knowledge Graphs, and how to use Schema to feed AI models.



HOW TO APPLY (MANDATORY):

To prove you are a human and an expert, please answer these 3 questions at the top of your application message. Applications without these answers will be ignored.



1. Question: A Webflow site uses Weglot. Google Search Console shows an "Unsupported File Format" error for the sitemap. You check the browser, and the sitemap looks fine (text is there). What is the likely technical error in the HTTP Header?

2. Question: We want to validly use "aggregateRating" (Stars) and "audience" properties in the same Schema block. 
 structure do you recommend to avoid validation errors?

3. Personality: What is your favorite tool for debugging HTTP headers and why?



We offer a stable long-term position and treat our team with respect. Looking forward to your application!

title: Full-Time Virtual Assistant for Product Engineer (QA, Research, Admin)
description:
# Full-Time Virtual Assistant for Product Engineer (QA, Research, Admin)



## About Me



I'm the lead product engineer at a small, early-stage AI startup based in the US. I work remotely from Thailand (GMT+7). I'm looking for a reliable, detail-oriented Virtual Assistant to work with me full-time and help me stay focused on high-impact engineering and product work.



You'll take ownership of QA testing, research, document management, and general personal admin — the things that need to get done but don't need to be done by me. Think of this as being the right hand to a senior engineer at a fast-moving tech company.



This is a great role if you're curious about technology, enjoy variety in your work, and want to grow your skills in a tech startup environment. You don't need to be a developer, but you should be comfortable navigating web apps, spreadsheets, and picking up new tools quickly.



**Your timezone advantage:** I'm based in Thailand (GMT+7), just 1 hour behind the Philippines. You'll work normal PH business hours with near-perfect overlap — no late nights or early mornings.



**Important:** This role is a mix of professional and personal support. You'll help me with work tasks (QA, research, documents, issue tracking) as well as personal admin (travel, scheduling, errands). If you're only looking for one or the other, this probably isn't the right fit — but if you like variety and want to be someone's go-to person for getting things done, read on.



## What You'll Do



### QA Testing



- Test new features in the web app and Google Sheets add-on following test scripts

- Report bugs clearly with screenshots, steps to reproduce, and expected vs. actual behavior

- Verify bug fixes and do regression checks

- Help maintain a library of test cases



### Research



- Research technical topics, tools, APIs, and competitors when assigned

- Summarize findings in clear, well-structured documents

- Use AI tools (ChatGPT, etc.) to accelerate research — we'll train you on effective prompting

- Monitor competitors (features, pricing, content) with weekly summaries



### Document Management



- Organize and maintain Google Drive folders, documents, and spreadsheets

- Create polished documents for planning, research summaries, and internal stakeholder reporting

- Prepare meeting agendas and capture action items / follow-ups

- Maintain internal knowledge base and SOPs



### Data Quality



- Spot-check event data for accuracy (dates, URLs, descriptions, locations)

- Flag data issues and help maintain data quality standards

- Assist with data entry and cleanup tasks



### Bug/Issue Tracking



- Keep the issue tracker organized: tagging, deduplicating, and closing stale issues

- Format QA findings into clean, actionable bug reports

- Track issue status and follow up on blockers



### Personal Admin



- Organize travel (flights, hotels, itineraries)

- Manage personal calendar and schedule coordination

- Handle
 triage and basic correspondence

- Expense tracking and basic bookkeeping support

- General errands and personal tasks as needed



## Tools You'll Use



- Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets, Drive, Calendar, Gmail)

- Project management (e.g., Linear, Notion, or similar)

- Communication (Slack, Loom)

- AI tools (ChatGPT, Claude) for research assistance

- Web browsers for QA testing

- Basic spreadsheet skills (filtering, formatting, formulas)



## Requirements



- Excellent written English

- Strong attention to detail (this is critical for QA and data work)

- Comfortable learning new software tools quickly

- Self-starter who can work independently with minimal supervision

- Reliable internet connection and quiet workspace

- Available for full-time work (40 hrs/week), Mon-Fri during PH business hours



## Nice to Have



- Experience with QA testing or bug reporting

- Familiarity with tech startups or SaaS products

- Experience using Google Sheets add-ons

- Basic understanding of web applications

- Experience with AI/LLM tools



## What I Offer



- Full-time, long-term position

- Nearly identical timezone (no late nights or early mornings)

- Exposure to cutting-edge AI and SaaS technology

- Variety — no two days are the same

- Respectful, low-drama working relationship

- Training provided on all tools and processes



**Salary:** Competitive, based on experience. Please include your expected monthly rate.



## To Apply



Please answer these questions in your application:



1. Describe a time you found and reported a bug or error in a product, document, or process. What did you do?

2. What AI tools (if any) have you used, and for what purpose?

3. What is your expected monthly salary in USD?

title: Credit Operations Lead – Palayan
description:
**Important** - Must be based in these locations:



Cabanatuan. Palayan City, Laur and the other surrounding towns.



About TrustClub



TrustClub is building a global network of trust – where reputation becomes currency.



We help people and small businesses access opportunities, loans, and partnerships based on trust, not paperwork.

We believe trust should be profitable, and that communities grow stronger when people vouch for each other.



Ultimately higher trust means people can work with each other more easily and everyone gets richer. This is true across the world and we are starting with the Philippines, one town at a time.



Your Role:



We are launching BNPL & Micro Lending for everyone on the TrustClub network in Palayan City (this means everyone, we don't do credit scoring, we rely 100% on trust & the platform processes). 



Your job will be to run a controlled pilot of this. 



You will operate a credit system powered by reputation and vouching rather than credit bureau data. At a high level, it will be your job to ensure:



 • Loans are issued correctly

 • Risk exposure is controlled

 • Collections remain proactive (this shouldn't be needed within TC, but it's possible)

 • Default rates stay below 3% (currently at 0.6%)

 • Reporting is up to date and you have the data at your fingertips



You responsibilities: 



 • Credit Execution: Review and approve trust-based loan applications, verify KYC and vouching legitimacy

 • BNPL Management: Oversee daily BNPL issuance across selected merchants and ensure repayment cycles remain controlled and compliant.

 • Risk Control: Monitor outstanding exposure, track delinquency daily, and prevent risk stacking or over-leveraging of borrowers.

 • Collections Oversight: Proactively manage repayments, trigger vouching-chain accountability when needed, and resolve late accounts professionally.

 • Compliance & Documentation: Maintain full regulatory and partner compliance with accurate, auditable loan and repayment records.

 • Reporting: Deliver weekly performance reports covering active loans, delinquency, exposure levels, and merchant BNPL activity.



What We Offer



- Base pay plus growth bonuses

- Path to leadership

- The chance to change how the world measures trust

- The opportunity to change your region for the better

Key Responsibilities

Convert both:

 - clear next steps and reminders,

Nice to Have

Experience handling high-net-worth clients with confidence, discretion, and professionalism.

Compensation

Commission: per closed booking (details shared during interview)



OTE (monthly): $1,000 – $5,000 depending on performance

High performers will earn more. Consistency and professionalism are rewarded.



How to Apply (Important)



To apply, please send:



A short summary of your closing background:



what you sold, typical deal size,



phone closing experience,



written follow-up closing experience,



your strongest closing environment (inbound/outbound).



Your estimated close rate (or best realistic estimate) and weekly volume handled.



Optional but recommended: a short Loom (2–4 minutes) introducing yourself and explaining your closing approach.



Start your application with this keyword on the first line: YACHT-CLOSER

title: Supply Chain & Inventory Planning Manager (Full Time)
description:
We are a fast-growing e-commerce fashion bag brand based in Singapore.



We are looking for a highly analytical, systems-driven Supply Chain & Inventory Planning Manager to take full ownership of our inventory planning engine and supply chain performance.



If you enjoy building forecasting systems, optimizing inventory turns, preventing stockouts, and turning messy data into structured decision-making - this role is for you. This is a decision-making role - not a coordination role.



[Role Overview]

You will own our end-to-end inventory planning and supply chain optimization process.



Your primary responsibility is to ensure:

- We do not run out of stock

- We do not over-order

- Cash is not trapped in aging inventory

- Inventory is allocated correctly across markets

- Lead times are tracked and optimized

- You will build, refine, and manage the systems that determine when and how much we reorder.



You will work closely with:

- Founders

- Operations Executive

- 3PL partners

- Suppliers



[Key Responsibilities]

1. Demand Forecasting & Replenishment Planning

- Maintain and improve SKU-level forecasting models (Google Sheets-based)

- Track daily/weekly sales velocity by SKU

- Build reorder logic based on lead time, safety stock, and MOQ

- Recommend purchase quantities and reorder timing

- Identify potential stockout risks at least 60 days in advance



2. Inventory Optimization

- Monitor inventory levels across SG and US warehouses

- Allocate inventory strategically between markets

- Track inventory turnover rate

- Identify slow-moving and aging SKUs

- Recommend action plans (bundling, promotions, discontinuation)



3. Supplier & Lead Time Management

- Track production timelines

- Monitor actual vs expected lead times

- Flag delays and risk areas early

- Optimize MOQ decisions and production batching



4. Freight & Logistics Optimization

- Recommend shipping mode (air vs sea) based on margin and urgency

- Coordinate inbound shipments with Ops team



5. Reporting & Performance Tracking

- Maintain weekly supply chain dashboard

Report on:

- Stock cover (days of inventory)

- OOS risk

- Inventory aging

- Inventory turns

- Open PO pipeline

- Conduct monthly supply chain review with founders



[Success Metrics]

You will be evaluated on:

- Stockout rate

- Inventory turnover improvement

- Reduction in aged inventory

- Forecast accuracy

- On-time PO execution



[Who This Role Is For]

- Highly analytical and comfortable working with data

- Strong Excel / Google Sheets skills (required)

- Experience in inventory planning or supply chain management

- Process-driven and systems-oriented

- Comfortable making recommendations based on numbers

- Proactive in identifying risks early



[Who This Role Is NOT For]

- Someone who only wants to coordinate shipments

- Someone uncomfortable with numbers and forecasting

- Someone who prefers reactive execution instead of proactive planning

- Someone who needs constant supervision



[Requirements]

- 3+ years experience in supply chain, inventory planning, or operations

- Experience in e-commerce or DTC brand preferred

- Strong understanding of MOQs, lead times, safety stock, reorder points

- Advanced proficiency in Google Sheets or Excel

- Strong communication skills (written and verbal)

- Comfortable working remotely and independently



[What We Offer]

- Fully remote role

- High ownership and autonomy

- Opportunity to build a supply chain system from the ground up

- Direct collaboration with founders

- Performance-based growth opportunities



APPLY AT THIS LINK:

title: International Education Researcher
description:
About Us

Educational Records Evaluation Service (ERES) is a trusted evaluation agency in the United States, providing credential evaluation services for international students, professionals, and immigrants. 



Position Overview

We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytical International Education Researcher to join our growing team. This role is ideal for someone passionate about global education systems and experienced in comparing international academic credentials against U.S. standards.

You will play a key role in supporting our credential evaluation team by conducting in-depth research on foreign education systems, academic policies, institutional recognition, grading practices, and program structures.



Responsibilities

• Conduct thorough research on education systems, qualifications frameworks, and credential structures across various countries

• Analyze foreign academic documents and provide insight into degree equivalencies

• Develop and maintain internal country-specific education profiles and databases

• Verify institutional recognition and program accreditation

• Collaborate with evaluation staff to provide timely, well-documented guidance on complex cases

• Monitor changes in global education systems, policies, and credential types

• Participate in professional development and networking related to international education

Qualifications

• Bachelor’s degree required; Master’s degree in Education, International Studies, Library Science, Linguistics, or a related field preferred

• Experience in international education, credential evaluation, academic research, or comparative education highly preferred

• Strong analytical and writing skills

• High attention to detail and accuracy

• Ability to work independently and manage multiple research tasks

• Familiarity with databases and education resource tools) is a plus

• Multilingual ability is a plus



Why Join Us?

• Flexible work environment

• Opportunity to contribute to educational equity and international mobility

• Work with a collaborative, mission-driven team

• Room for professional growth and contribution to policy shaping



How to Apply

Please submit your resume, a brief cover letter, and one writing sample (preferably related to education or research) via Google Drive or another accessible online platform link within the "Onlinejobs" messaging system.

We welcome applicants from diverse backgrounds and experiences. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis.

title: Appointment Setter
description:
Outbound Appointment Setter

About Cynergists

We provide advanced AI solutions designed to empower businesses to automate workflows, maximize productivity, and unlock limitless growth. We don’t just fill seats; we deploy operations. Cynergists is moving beyond traditional staffing to define the future of intelligent automation.

The Role

We are looking for a high-energy, resilient Outbound Appointment Setter to be the engine of our growth. You are the first point of contact between Cynergists and the business world. Your mission is simple: Open doors. You don’t need a decade of sales experience, but you do need "thick skin" and a relentless work ethic. Your goal is to spark curiosity, identify operational pain points, and schedule discovery calls for our senior consultants. If you are coachable, our proprietary AI Sales Trainer will help you master the art of the "hook."

Key Responsibilities

High-Volume Outreach: Execute daily outbound sprints via cold calling, personalized
, and LinkedIn outreach to identify potential clients.

The "Hook": Effectively communicate the value of AI automation to secure a spot on our consultants' calendars.

Lead Qualification: Briefly assess a prospect's current workflow to ensure they are a fit for our automation services.

Appointment Setting: Your primary KPI is Booked & Showed meetings. You bridge the gap between a cold lead and a diagnostic consultation.

Rapid Skill Development: Work daily with our AI Sales Trainer to refine your pitch, master tonality, and handle objections in real-time.

Pipeline Management: Utilize Go High Level (GHL) to track outreach, manage follow-ups, and ensure no lead falls through the cracks.

What We Are Looking For

Resilience: You view "No" as a request for more information. You have the stamina for high-volume outbound activity.

Coachability is King: You are hungry for feedback. You must be willing to train with our AI coach and adapt your approach based on data.

Tech-Savvy Mindset: You don't need to be a coder, but you must be excited about AI and comfortable navigating software.

Communication: Clear, confident verbal and written communication skills are non-negotiable.

GHL Experience: Proficiency in Go High Level is a plus, but not required if you are a fast learner.

Why Join Cynergists?

Cutting-Edge Training: Access to our proprietary AI Sales Trainer, providing you with real-time feedback and development.

Sell the Future: You aren't selling outdated services; you are selling the most in-demand technology in the world.

Uncapped Earning Potential: Competitive commission structure based on booked meetings and closed deals.

Remote Freedom: Work from anywhere with a supportive, innovative team.



To Apply

If you are ready to pivot your career into the world of Artificial Intelligence, submit your resume to 
 your cover letter, tell us why you think AI is the future of business.

You will also perform outreach through social media and messaging platforms to generate new leads.

title: Amazon Account Manager / Operations Manager
description:
Are you a strategic, data-driven brand builder with a passion for Amazon?

We are a fast-growing Amazon private label brand looking for a full-time Amazon Account Manager to take ownership of our product development pipeline, listing optimization, and brand positioning.



You’ll play a key leadership role in launching products, optimizing conversion rates, and developing a strong, consistent brand presence. This is a long-term opportunity with potential for growth in a collaborative, performance-driven environment.



Key Responsibilities

-Accountability & Ownership

-Lead and maintain a robust product development pipeline (from idea to launch)

-Optimize product listings for maximum visibility and conversions

-Manage all branding, positioning, and messaging efforts

-Implement CRO strategies and run continuous A/B tests

-Coordinate freelancers (designers, photographers, content creators)

-Monitor and improve brand health metrics: rankings, reviews, CTR, CR, etc.



Daily & Weekly Tasks

-Research product trends and discover new product ideas

-Analyze competitors for differentiation and CRO opportunities

-Track performance: sessions, conversion rates, sales rank

-Collaborate with supply chain, PPC, and creative teams to align launch and inventory strategies



Long-Term Projects & Goals

-Build a consistent and strategic brand identity across all customer touchpoints

-Establish a repeatable, scalable system for product launches

-Increase customer loyalty and retention through compelling branding and messaging



 Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)

KPI 1: Product Development Pipeline

Objective: Develop and maintain a validated pipeline of launch-ready products

Metrics: 

-Number of product ideas researched and validated monthly

-Number of products launched per quarter

-First 90-day sales & review performance



Actions:

-Run research & validation using Helium 10 and market analysis

-Coordinate with suppliers, creatives, and PPC

-Maintain and update Product Pipeline Tracker



KPI 2: Conversion Rate Optimization

Objective: Improve listing performance through CRO strategies

Metric: Conversion Rate (%) from Amazon Business Reports

Actions:

-Optimize listings, copy, and A+ content

-Improve visuals and run split tests

-Monitor and iterate based on data and performance feedback



 Qualifications & Skills

Required:

-3+ years of experience managing private label brands on Amazon

-Proven success with multiple product launches

-Deep understanding of Amazon SEO and the Amazon algorithm

-Expertise in Helium 10, keyword research, and listing optimization

-Skilled in briefing and coordinating designers and content teams

-Familiarity with A+ content, storefront management, and conversion tracking



Preferred:

-Background in marketing, branding, or e-commerce growth strategy

-Knowledge of CRO tools and testing platforms (e.g., ManageByStats, Splitly)

-Experience using tools like Asana, Notion, or Trello for project management

-Awareness of PPC’s influence on organic ranking



 Soft Skills:

-High attention to detail and ownership mentality

-Strong marketing sense and customer-centric thinking

-Excellent written and verbal English communication

-Organized, self-driven, and proactive

-Analytical mindset – able to turn data into decisions



 What We Offer

-Competitive rates

-Fully remote, flexible working hours

-Bi-weekly payments and performance reviews

-Long-term role with growth potential

-Paid leave and additional benefits after 6 months (SSS, Pag-ibig, health insurance)

-Supportive team culture with room for innovation and contribution

-Training resources and personal development opportunities



 How to Apply:

1. Include in subject line: “[Your Favorite Book] - Amazon Brand Manager Application”

2. Attach your updated resume

3. Include a short video (2–3 min) introducing yourself and describing your:

-Experience with Amazon product research

-Tools you’ve used and how you used them

-One product you’ve helped launch and what made it successful

4. Complete the internet speed test from speedtest.net and attach a screenshot

5. Attach a screenshot with your computer specs.



Why Join Us?

This is more than just a brand management job. It’s an opportunity to lead, build, and scale something meaningful. If you’re driven by impact, autonomy, and a clear path to success, we’d love to meet you.

title: Remote Appointment Setter / Cold Caller – Performance-Based
description:
Close your eyes for a second.

Imagine the sound of a V12 engine echoing down a glass-lit boulevard.

Young entrepreneurs — barely out of school — earning in a month what most people make in a year.

Waking up with freedom.

Traveling when they want.

Moving fast because their money moves fast.

And you?

Still telling yourself “patience” while others press buttons, make calls, build momentum, and win.

Here’s the truth.

The world doesn’t reward thinkers.

It rewards action.

Most people overanalyze.

They hesitate.

They wait for perfect timing.

They stay average.

But a small percentage want MORE.

They refuse to live a normal life.

They refuse to settle for comfortable.

They refuse to be anything less than spectacular.

We are building that percentage.

This is a remote cold calling / appointment setting position in high-ticket real estate lead generation.

No office.

No commute.

No ceiling.

Laptop.

Phone.

Execution.

Momentum creates money.

If you move fast, you win.

If you sit still, you watch others pass you.

This is for the competitive.

For the ones who handle rejection without emotion.

For the ones who execute without excuses.

For the ones who want performance-based income.

For the ones who are tired of average.

This is not for the overthinkers.

Not for the excuse-makers.

Not for the slow movers.

Not for those who need supervision to function.

The smarter you are, the more you think.

The more you think, the less you move.

The less you move, the less you earn.

Thinking is theory.

Action is reality.

The only question is —

Are you going to start the engine, or keep watching from the sidewalk?

title: Full-Stack Developer - Web and Mobile (React / React Native / Node.js / TypeScript)
description:
About Us



We build custom web applications for clients across a range of industries. We are growing our team and looking for a skilled full-stack developer to work on an active client project and future builds using the same technology stack.

We use Replit as our primary development and deployment platform, with AI-assisted development tools playing a central role in our workflow. You will be working directly within Replit's environment, collaborating with our team to build, refine, and maintain production applications.



The Role



You will be joining us to work on an various client projects requiring ongoing feature development, bug fixes, and UI refinement required. We have a pipeline of future web and mobile applications that will be built using the same stack and development approach.



Your day-to-day work will include:



- Building and refining features across the full stack (frontend and backend)

- Applying designs from Figma/HTML mockups to the existing application layout

- Developing and maintaining mobile applications using React Native

- Writing clean, maintainable TypeScript code

- Troubleshooting and resolving bugs across the application

- Collaborating with our team via regular communication and project updates



Tech Stack



You should be comfortable working with most (ideally all) of the following:



Backend: Node.js (v20+), Express.js with TypeScript, PostgreSQL with Drizzle ORM, session-based authentication, No
er, PDFKit, Google Cloud Storage

Frontend: React 18 with TypeScript, Vite, Tailwind CSS, shadcn/ui (Radix UI), TanStack React Query v5, Wouter (routing), Recharts, Uppy (file uploads)

Mobile: React Native

What We Are Looking For



- Mid-level to senior full-stack developer (5+ years experience) who can work independently with minimal supervision

- Strong frontend skills with the ability to translate Figma designs and HTML mockups into polished, responsive UI

- Solid backend skills, comfortable building APIs, working with relational databases, and handling authentication flows

- Hands-on experience with React and TypeScript is essential

- Proven experience building and publishing mobile applications with React Native

- Experience with Tailwind CSS and component libraries like shadcn/ui is highly desirable

- Familiarity with PostgreSQL (or similar relational databases) and an ORM



- Good English communication skills (written and spoken)

- Reliable internet connection and a quiet working environment

- Available to overlap with Sydney AEDT (currently a 7am start in the Philippines)



Nice to Have



- Experience with Drizzle ORM or similar TypeScript-first ORMs

- Familiarity with AI-assisted development workflows

- Experience with Google Cloud Storage or similar cloud storage services

- Experience publishing apps to the Apple App Store and Google Play Store

- Previous experience working with Australian or Western clients remotely



How to Apply

Please include the following in your application:



- A brief summary of your relevant experience, particularly with React, React Native, TypeScript, and Node.js

- Links to projects or repositories that demonstrate your full-stack and mobile work (GitHub, portfolio, live projects, or app store links)

- A short description of your experience working with component libraries and translating designs into code

- Confirmation that: you are OK with using screenshot capture software for time tracking; are happy with Sydney working hours; are happy working an exclusive role (that means no freelance paid or unpaid work 'on the side'); and you would be willing to undergo a live technical assessment as part of the interview process.

title: Virtual Technical Assistant — Ship Features via Claude Code (Early-Stage EdTech/AgTech Startup, Ongoing)
description:
About Us

Show Circle is a Texas-based platform that helps 4-H and FFA students (ages 9–19) share their livestock project stories and receive support from family and community members who can't attend shows in person. We're live with real users, preparing for rapid growth across Texas, and moving fast. Our stack is React/TypeScript on the frontend, Supabase (Postgres, Edge Functions, Auth, Storage, RLS) on the backend, Stripe Connect for payments, and Resend for transactional
. Code lives in GitHub, and Loveable handles deployment — push to main and it auto-deploys.

How We Work

We use Claude Code as our primary development tool. You'll work from the terminal, running Claude Code against our codebase to build features, fix bugs, and ship changes. A CLAUDE.md project file already exists with our full architecture, database schema, RLS patterns, component conventions, and terminology rules — Claude Code reads it automatically every session. You won't be writing code from scratch most of the time. You'll be directing Claude Code with clear instructions, reviewing what it produces, and pushing to GitHub.

If you haven't used Claude Code before but you're comfortable in a terminal, can read React/TypeScript, and have worked with Supabase or similar — you'll pick it up fast. We'll walk you through setup on Day 1.

Day 1: Setup

Your first task is getting the development loop working:



Install Claude Code (one terminal command)

Authenticate with your Claude Pro or Max subscription

Clone our GitHub repo

Drop in the CLAUDE.md project context file

Ship a small fix to prove the loop (we have a one-line database fix ready to go)

Confirm push ? Loveable auto-deploy works



Half a day. After that, you're building.

What You'll Be Shipping

Current priorities, roughly in order:



Fix COPPA compliance bugs in the under-13 signup flow (fields not saving to the database, parent approval status not being set)

Fix Supabase auth
 branding (still shows old project name)

Resolve Yahoo
 authentication issue in Supabase config

Add
 logging to 9 edge functions

Fix cents-to-dollars conversion in admin payout dashboard

Audit all edge functions for correct
 sender domain

Deploy Knowledge Base (5 articles written, needs implementation)

Build "Give Now" immediate payment flow (full spec exists)

Build post-show charge automation with pg_cron

Build CSV Migration Assistant for importing existing records

Build Post-Show Analytics student dashboard

Homepage redesign implementation

PDF Record Book Export

QA Admin Dashboard Phase 2 (7 modules shipped but untested)



Specs and detailed requirements exist for most of these. You're not designing — you're executing against clear specs with a powerful AI coding tool.

Other Responsibilities



Run QA scripts on mobile and desktop, document issues, verify fixes

Supabase administration (migrations, RLS policies, Edge Functions, auth config, storage)

Stripe Connect monitoring and troubleshooting

Keep backlog and documentation current in GitHub

DNS/email deliverability management (Resend, SPF/DKIM/DMARC)

Plausible Analytics monitoring for signup funnel health



What We're Not Looking For

This isn't a "wait for instructions" role. You'll have clear priorities and specs, but we need someone who flags when something doesn't look right, asks the right questions before burning hours, and closes loops without being chased.

Ideal Candidate



Comfortable in a terminal and with git workflows

Can read and navigate React/TypeScript (you don't need to write complex components from scratch — Claude Code handles that — but you need to understand what you're looking at)

Experience with Supabase, Firebase, or similar BaaS platforms

Familiarity with Stripe Connect or Stripe payment integrations

Has used AI-assisted dev tools (Claude Code, Cursor, Copilot, Replit Agent, or similar) — or is eager to learn

Strong written communication — you'll be reporting back to the founder and updating docs

Bonus: familiarity with agricultural youth programs, rural communities, or COPPA compliance



Details



10–20 hours/week (flexible, varies by sprint)

Fully remote, US-based preferred

$25–40/hr depending on experience

Ongoing engagement, minimum 3-month commitment

You'll need your own Claude Pro subscription ($20/mo) for Claude Code access

Tools provided: GitHub access, Supabase dashboard, Stripe dashboard, Loveable workspace, Resend account

title: Senior Risk & Compliance Consultant (Fintech & Crypto)
description:
We need an expert who bridges the gap between Web2 Traditional Finance (Fiat Rails) and Web3 On-chain Compliance.

Your core mission is not just to be a "blocker," but to "design safe mechanisms that enable business velocity." You will ensure we pass the rigorous onboarding requirements of our banking partners (e.g., Cybrid's AML program review) while managing the operational risks of a high-volume payment platform.



Key Responsibilities

Compliance Program Build-out

Draft BSA/AML Policies from Scratch: Create internal compliance policy documents (CIP, AML, OFAC) that meet US banking standards. This is a prerequisite for going live with partners like Cybrid.

Define KYC/KYB Standards: Design tiered identity verification workflows for our dual-track business (B2B Agency + B2C Palau ID). Define limits and requirements for Tier 1 vs. Tier 2 users.

Regulatory Strategy: Assess licensing requirements (MTL/MSB/MiCA) for US, Canada, and EU markets, providing a strategic roadmap for the next 12-24 months.

Operational Risk & Fraud Prevention

ACH Risk Management: specifically for ACH Pull scenarios. Design logic to mitigate NSF (Insufficient Funds) and Unauthorized Returns (e.g., balance checks via Plaid, settlement holding periods).

On-Chain Risk Integration: Configure on-chain analysis tools (e.g., GoPlus, Chainalysis, Elliptic) to define blocking rules for high-risk wallet addresses.

Transaction Monitoring: Set up velocity limits and alert rules for suspicious activities; handle Suspicious Activity Reports (SARs) if necessary.

Partner Enablement

Due Diligence (DD): Represent the company in handling compliance inquiries from upstream banking partners and infrastructure providers (Cybrid, Hex Trust), assisting in completing complex DD questionnaires.

Vendor Assessment: Evaluate the compliance robustness of new payment rails (e.g., European SEPA, Asian local payouts).



Requirements

Experience: 5+ years of risk/compliance experience in Fintech or Crypto Exchanges. Must have hands-on experience with US Banking Rails (ACH/Wire).

Expertise:

Deep knowledge of FinCEN, OFAC sanctions, and AML workflows.

Strong understanding of the "FBO Account" model and the legal boundaries of a "Money Transmitter."

Understanding of stablecoin (USDC) minting and burning flows.

Tool Stack: Familiarity with industry-standard tools like Persona (Identity), Plaid (Bank Auth), and Chainalysis/TRM Labs (Crypto AML).

Mindset: Ability to balance "Compliance Requirements" with "User Experience." We don't need a bureaucrat; we need a builder who offers solutions.



Bonus Points

Certified Anti-Money Laundering Specialist (CAMS) certification.

Experience helping startups successfully onboard with Zero Hash, Cybrid, Circle, or Stripe.

Knowledge of RNS.ID (Palau Digital Residency) or similar sovereign identity projects.

Familiarity with India TDS tax regulations or Philippines cross-border remittance laws.

title: Data Protection Officer (DPO)
description:
As the DPO, you will be responsible for ensuring our company’s compliance with data protection regulations, implementing robust data protection policies and procedures, and safeguarding the privacy and protection of the data of our employees, customers, and stakeholders.

This is a critical role that requires a deep understanding of data privacy laws, excellent communication skills, and the ability to collaborate effectively across various departments.



 Responsibilities:



1. Data Protection and Privacy Policies:



• Develop, implement, and maintain data protection policies and controls to ensure regulatory compliance.

• Conduct audits to monitor compliance and collaborate with legal teams to address data protection issues.

• Ensure compliance for third-party vendors and update policies as necessary.



2. Privacy Impact Assessments and Data Mapping:



• Conduct Data Protection Impact Assessments (DPIAs) for new projects and perform data mapping to identify privacy risks.

• Develop and implement mitigation strategies and regularly update DPIAs and data mapping exercises.

• Monitor emerging technologies for privacy impacts.



3. Data Subject Rights and Consent Management:



• Manage processes for data subject requests (e.g., access, erasure) and obtain and manage consent for data processing.

• Ensure compliance with consent requirements and periodically review processes.



4. Training and Awareness:



• Provide regular training on data protection and regulatory requirements.

• Develop specialized training for high-risk data processing and integrate data protection into onboarding.



5. Security I
 Management and Breach Response:



• Develop and maintain an i
 response plan and coordinate with teams to manage breaches.

• Conduct post-i
 reviews and implement prevention measures.



6. Vendor Management:



• Implement a vendor management program to assess and monitor data protection practices.

• Review and negotiate data processing agreements and conduct regular compliance audits.



7. Regulatory Compliance and Reporting:



• Maintain an inventory of data protection laws and serve as the contact for regulatory authorities.

• Prepare reports on data protection activities and i
.



8. Privacy by Design and Data Governance:



• Integrate privacy by design principles into product development and implement data governance frameworks.

• Monitor and recommend improvements for data governance compliance.



9. General Recommendation:



• Recommend strategies to management for enhancing overall data protection practices, addressing compliance gaps, and improving privacy and security measures across the organization.



Qualifications and Skills:



• Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) in computer science or related field such as information security, data protection, law, or a related discipline.

• Proficiency with software for preparing reports and presentations

• Proven experience as a Data Protection Officer or in a similar role, preferably in a technology or data-driven organization.

• In-depth knowledge of global data protection laws and regulations, such as GDPR, CCPA, and other regional frameworks.

• Familiarity with privacy-by-design principles and practical implementation strategies.

• Strong understanding of data security, encryption, anonymization techniques, and data lifecycle management.

• Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to assess and manage privacy risks effectively.

• Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders at all levels.

• Professional certifications such as Certified Information Privacy Professional (CIPP) or Certified Data Protection Officer (CDPO) are highly desirable.

• Knowledge of emerging technologies, such as artificial intelligence, machine learning, and cloud computing, and their implications for data protection is a plus.



Data Protection Officer and play a vital role in ensuring the privacy and security of sensitive data while driving compliance with global data protection regulations.

Apply your expertise in data privacy and make a meaningful impact on our company’s commitment to protecting data and maintaining the trust of our employees, customers and partners.

title: Market Research Virtual Assistant (U.S. Real Estate – Data Analysis & Local Market Research)
description:

We are looking for a highly detail-oriented Virtual Assistant to conduct structured market research on small towns and cities in Texas, USA.



Your primary responsibility will be identifying communities that show stable population trends, strong economic stability, and limited competition in specific industries (primarily self-storage real estate).



This is research-heavy work that requires independent thinking, strong data gathering skills, and excellent organization.



Main Responsibilities

 • Research towns and cities within a 90-minute drive of Frisco, Texas

 • Identify local economic activity and major employers
