 • Identify and analyze existing self-storage facilities in each town

 • Determine if new storage construction has occurred or is planned

 • Gather information from local government and public data sources

 • Organize findings into structured spreadsheets

 • Write short summary reports explaining key insights and risks



?



Required Skills

 • Advanced attention to detail

 • Ability to follow structured research criteria

 • Strong written English communication

 • Ability to verify information from multiple sources

 • Organized and dependable



?



Preferred (but not required)

 • Real estate research experience

 • Market research or data analysis background

 • Experience using government or public data sources

 • Familiarity with demographics or economic development research

The Mission

I’m a former CEO and magazine publisher seeking a sharp, proactive virtual tax accountant who gets things right the first time, anticipates next steps, and builds clean systems that actually stick. This role is light and predictable long-term; the real lift is upfront—organizing and systematizing in time for the April 15, 2025 deadline.



What You’ll Do

Prepare and/or coordinate filing of personal taxes and two rental properties

(Preference for methods that do not require sharing bank logins)



Recommend and implement practical tools—simple, secure, and sustainable



Create clarity without overengineering



Who You Are



A true go-getter who anticipates needs and follows through



Precise, organized, and calm under deadlines



Proactive communicator—responsive and reliable



Comfortable working with high-performing, professional clients

You take pride in making complex things feel simple—and making your clients feel on top of their finances.

Send a brief note explaining:

What the first 10 days would look like

title: MCA Underwriter | Full-Time EST
description:
Hours: Mon–Fri, EST business hours overlap required





About the Role

We're a merchant cash advance company looking for a skilled underwriter to join our team. You'll be responsible for reviewing MCA applications, analyzing merchant financials, assessing risk, and making funding recommendations. This is a high-volume, fast-paced role where speed and accuracy both matter. You'll work directly with our sales and funding teams to move deals through the pipeline efficiently.



What You'll Do



Review and analyze incoming MCA applications and supporting documents

Examine 3–6 months of business bank statements to evaluate cash flow, daily balances, and revenue trends

Identify red flags such as NSFs, negative balances, stacking, and undisclosed positions

Calculate key metrics including average daily balance, monthly revenue, and deposit consistency

Determine funding amounts, hold-back percentages, and terms based on risk assessment

Issue approvals, declines, or request additional documentation with clear reasoning

Communicate underwriting decisions to the sales team with turnaround expectations

Maintain accurate records and notes in the CRM/underwriting platform

Meet daily volume targets (typically 15–25+ applications per day)

Stay current on MCA industry trends, compliance requirements, and risk factors





Requirements

Must-haves:



2+ years of hands-on MCA or alternative lending underwriting experience

Strong ability to read and interpret business bank statements quickly

Understanding of MCA-specific risk factors — stacking, split funding, seasonal businesses, etc.

Experience calculating daily balances, average monthly revenue, and position exposure

High attention to detail with the ability to spot inconsistencies and fraud indicators

Comfortable working in a fast-paced, high-volume environment

Reliable internet connection and quiet workspace

Available during US business hours (at least 9 AM–5 PM EST)

Strong written English for internal communication and deal notes



Nice-to-haves:



Experience with underwriting tools like DecisionLogic, Plaid, Ocrolus, or LendingFront

Familiarity with CRMs such as Salesforce, HubSpot, or industry-specific platforms

Background in other alternative lending products (revenue-based financing, business lines of credit, equipment financing)

Experience training or mentoring junior underwriters

Knowledge of UCC filings and lien searches





What We Offer



Stable, long-term full-time position — not a short-term project

Clear underwriting guidelines and support — you won't be guessing

Opportunity to grow into a senior or lead underwriter role

A team that values speed, good judgment, and reliability

title: Founding Operations Partner / Future Chief of Staff (US Tech Startup)
description:
Please watch Loom about the project.





If link doesn't appear, manually enter: loom dot com / share / 3f0a09caa61845dc8e6a65598ef724b9



Hi, I'm Jack. I am a solo founder building a US-based technology startup called DearlySent. We are building a social relationship network designed to bridge the gap between digital intention and physical action. My goal over the next decade is to serve 100 million monthly active users and fundamentally change the way human beings show care and love to one another.



I personally work 12 hours a day, 6 days a week, and I absolutely love what I do. I am intensely driven, but I cannot scale this alone. I am looking for my right-hand partner. I am looking for someone with high fluid intelligence, deep empathy, and a builder’s mindset to join me on the ground floor.



**My Promise to You (The Anti-Micromanagement Guarantee):**



This is not a daycare. You are an adult, and you will be treated as a peer and a partner.



- I will **never** use Time Doctor, Hubstaff, or any screen-recording software.

    

- I will **never** force you to punch a clock.

    

- I do not want your mechanical hours; I want your mind, your heart, and your soul. We will work in symbiosis to build something incredible. I care about output, execution, and trust.

    



**The Trajectory & Compensation (The 4-Month Ramp):**



I do not pay hourly, because I do not want you to have "hours anxiety." If you build a system that saves us 10 hours a week, you should not be penalized with less pay. I pay a stable monthly salary for your output and ownership. We will scale your salary and your responsibilities together over the first four months:



- **Month 1 (The Foundation): $800 USD / month.** Expectation is roughly 20 hours of focused output a week. You will learn the DNA of the company, help with Ritz-Carlton level customer care, execute rigorous QA testing of our app, and build our initial operations tracking.

    

- **Month 2 (The Builder): $1,200 USD / month.** Expectation grows to ~30 hours a week. You take over affiliate outreach, competitor research, manage video creators, and build our Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs).

    

- **Month 3 (The Operator): $1,600 USD / month.** Nearing full-time. You take over daily operations so I can focus purely on engineering and marketing. You manage the digital fulfillment prep and own customer support.

    

- **Month 4+ (The Partner): $2,000 USD / month.** Full-time ownership. You are officially my Chief of Staff. You manage the systems, and when we are task-saturated and need to hire more people, _you_ will lead the interviews.

    



**Long-Term Respect & Benefits:**



- **13th Month Pay:** I proudly and proactively pay the 13th-month bonus every December.

    

- **Healthcare:** Once you reach Month 4 (Full Partner status), you will receive an additional $50/month stipend specifically for your local HMO.

    

- **Growth:** A guaranteed minimum 5% annual pay raise, with room for much higher performance-based increases as the company's revenue scales.

    



**Who You Are:**



- **Flawless English:** You will be communicating with our premium US customer base and directly with me.

    

- **Empathetic:** You actually care about people. Our company exists to remind people of their value.

    

- **A Systems Thinker:** You don't just solve a problem; you build a system so the problem never happens again.

    

- **Tech-Savvy:** You embrace AI (ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini) to make yourself faster and smarter.

    



---



### **How to Apply (The 3-Phase Hiring Process):**



To find the perfect partner, I do not read generic cover letters. We are breaking this process into three phases to ensure we are a perfect fit.



**PHASE 1: The Introduction**



Do not send a resume or a cover letter. Instead, record a 3-to-5 minute video (Loom, YouTube, etc.) answering these three exact questions:



1. Explain a complex technical or operational problem you solved in the past.

    

2. Tell me about a specific act of kindness you’ve done for someone recently, or something kind you would like to do for someone.

    

3. What is a piece of technology or software that you believe is perfectly engineered, and why?

    



Attention to Detail Check: Please make the subject line of your application message: "Generosity: [Your Name]" so I know you read this entire post).

Applications without videos will be immediately deleted and not reviewed.  



**PHASE 2: The Deep Dive**



I will review every single video. The top candidates will be invited to Round 2, where I will ask you to record a second video detailing your specific background, your career ambitions, and more personal details about who you are. 



**PHASE 3: The Paid Trial**



The top finalists will be paid $50 USD to complete a real-world practice project for our company and take a brief alignment/personality assessment. You will be actively encouraged to use AI to complete this project.



The final candidate will be offered the position immediately.



If you want to just clock in, do data entry, and clock out, please do not apply. If you want to build a unicorn startup, take ownership of a mission, and grow into a tech executive, send me your video. Let's build something incredible together.

title: Virtual Assistant - Amazon E-Commerce Business
description:
20 Hours/Week (w/ success Full-Time 40 hours possible) | Long-Term Role | Growth Opportunities



I run a fast-growing Amazon e-commerce business and am building a serious team, not hiring random freelancers. We are scaling aggressively, and this role is for someone who wants stable, long-term work, not side gigs.



If you are analytical, disciplined, and want to grow inside a real business — keep reading.



THIS IS NOT AN EASY JOB



This is a performance role. You will be trained, but results matter.



If you:

Need constant supervision

Guess instead of using data

Submit random products without analysis



This is not for you.



If you:

Think in numbers

Like research and data

Want stability and growth



You’ll do very well here.





YOUR MAIN RESPONSIBILITY



You will be finding profitable products to sell on Amazon using online stores and research tools.



This includes:

Product sourcing (Online Arbitrage & Wholesale when assigned)

Reading and analyzing Keepa charts

Using SellerAmp or similar tools



Checking:

Sales volume

Competition

Profit margins

ROI

Buy Box stability

Tracking all leads in spreadsheets

Following detailed SOPs



PERFORMANCE REQUIREMENTS



Your job is to submit QUALIFIED LEADS, not random links.



A product is considered qualified if it meets:

Estimated 50–200+ sales per month (higher is better)

Minimum $3.00 profit per unit

Minimum 30% ROI

Stable pricing history (no crashing)

No major Amazon risks (IP complaints, hazmat, etc.)

50 or less to Ungate or Already approved



Daily Target: 4-6 quality leads per day





TRAINING & GROWTH

You are required to improve.



Each week:

You will watch 1 training video

You will submit a short video showing you applying what you learned

This is a growth position. The better you get, the more valuable you become.



Meetings w/ Management monthly to review lead quality and areas of improvement



PAY

Trial Period Pay: $2.00/hour over 1-2 weeks



Once Hired:

Part Time: 20 hours per week (Opportunity to move to Full Time, 40 hours with Long Term Success)

Paid weekly



Performance Bonus:

+$1.00 for every lead that becomes a purchased product



IDEAL CANDIDATE

You are:

Detail-oriented

Comfortable with numbers and spreadsheets

Honest and reliable

Fast learner

Able to follow systems

Interested in long-term work and Growth

Experience with Amazon sourcing, Keepa, and/or SellerAmp is a HUGE advantage, but mindset matters more than experience.



IMPORTANT RULES



Work hours must overlap with PST

Strong internet connection required

Must be comfortable recording your screen when needed

This is a long-term role, not short-term freelance



HOW TO APPLY (REQUIRED)



To be considered, you must submit:

A 2–3 minute video introducing yourself

Your experience with Amazon or product research

What tools you have used (Keepa, SellerAmp, etc.)

Why you want a long-term role



Applications without video will be ignored.



WHO THIS JOB IS PERFECT FOR



Someone who wants:

Stable income

Long-term position

Growth inside an expanding business

To become highly skilled in Amazon sourcing 

Potential equity in a growing business



If that’s you — apply and prove it.

title: Operations Manager — Automation Agency
description:
Operations Manager Automation Agency |

Hours: Mon–Fri, EST business hours overlap required





Who We Are

We're a growing automation agency that builds custom n8n workflows, API integrations, and AI-powered systems for e-commerce and logistics companies. 



Who You Are

You're the person who walks into chaos and creates order — without being told how. You've managed operations at an agency or tech company before, you understand automation and APIs at a working level, and you don't need hand-holding to figure out what needs to happen next. You see a gap, you fill it. You see a fire, you put it out. You're the adult in the room.

This isn't a VA role. This is a right-hand operator position. You'll own the day-to-day operations so the founder can focus on selling and building.



What You'll Own



Client management — Be the main point of contact for active clients. Handle updates, requests, timelines, and expectations so the founder isn't in every Slack thread and
 chain.

Project management — Track all active builds across clients. Know what's on track, what's behind, and what's blocked — before anyone has to ask.

Scoping and QA — Review client requests, scope out what needs to be built, and QA completed n8n workflows and integrations before delivery. You don't need to be the best builder, but you need to understand what you're looking at.

Team management — Manage VAs and contractors. Assign tasks, review output, hold people accountable. Eventually, hire new tea
mbers as we grow.

Building systems — Create the SOPs, processes, and documentation that don't exist yet. Build the operating system for the agency from the ground up.

Light building — Handle simpler n8n workflows and automation builds independently, freeing the founder for complex architecture work.





Requirements



3+ years in operations, project management, or agency management

Working knowledge of automation tools — n8n, Make, or Zapier (you don't need to be an expert builder, but you need to understand workflows, APIs, and webhooks)

Experience managing remote teams (VAs, contractors, or developers)

Comfortable communicating directly with US-based clients via Slack,
, and occasional video calls

Highly organized with a track record of building processes where none existed

Self-directed — you figure out what needs to happen and do it without waiting for instructions

Strong written and spoken English



Apply Here:

title: LinkedIn Ghostwriter — AI & Automation Agency
description:
The Role

We're looking for someone to fully own and manage the founder's personal LinkedIn profile. The founder runs an automation agency serving e-commerce and logistics companies — so the content needs to reflect deep knowledge of AI, automation, and how businesses actually use these tools to grow. This isn't generic "5 tips for productivity" content. We need someone who understands the AI and automation space, follows the trends daily, and can turn that knowledge into scroll-stopping LinkedIn posts.



What You'll Do



Write and publish 4–5 LinkedIn posts per week in the founder's voice — a mix of insights, hot takes, case studies, and thought leadership around AI and automation

Stay on top of AI news and trends (new tools, use cases, industry shifts) and turn them into timely, relevant content

Engage daily on target prospects' and industry leaders' posts with thoughtful, value-adding comments — not generic fluff

Manage inbound DMs and send personalized outreach to potential clients and partners

Grow the founder's network strategically — connecting with e-commerce operators, logistics companies, agency owners, and tech decision-makers

Track key metrics weekly: follower growth, post impressions, engagement rate, DM response rate

Collaborate with the founder on content ideas — bring topics to the table, don't wait to be told what to write





Requirements



1+ year managing LinkedIn profiles (ghostwriting, personal branding, or agency experience)

Genuinely knowledgeable about AI and automation — you follow this space because you're interested, not because it's a job requirement

Can write in a natural, conversational, opinionated tone — not corporate, not ChatGPT-sounding

Understands the LinkedIn algorithm — what gets reach, what gets engagement, what gets ignored

Proactive and self-managing — you plan the content calendar, not the founder

Strong written English with the ability to match someone else's voice

Familiar with AI tools (ChatGPT, Claude, Midjourney, n8n, Make, etc.) — bonus if you actually use them



Apply here:

title: Photoshop Mockup Creator (PSD Smart Object Specialist)
description:
We are looking for a highly skilled Photoshop Mockup Creator who can create realistic PSD mockups from scratch.



?? These are NOT simple flat mockups.

?? These are NOT template edits.



You will be building mockups from JPG and PNG images and transforming them into fully editable, realistic PSD files.



Most of our products are non-flat, dimensional objects such as:

	•	Blankets (with folds and fabric texture)

	•	Mugs (curved surface wrapping)

	•	Cans (metal reflections)

	•	Jars (glass transparency and highlights)

	•	Candle jars

	•	Sticker label rolls

	•	Packaging with depth

	•	Other curved or textured surfaces



You must understand how to make designs look naturally wrapped, printed, or applied to these surfaces with correct lighting, perspective, and realism.



This role starts as project-based. If you consistently deliver high-quality work, we are open to hiring you part-time as a Graphic Designer.



?



Responsibilities

	•	Create realistic PSD mockups from scratch (not using pre-made templates)

	•	Convert JPG/PNG references into fully editable PSD files

	•	Create properly structured Smart Objects

	•	Apply designs realistically to curved and textured surfaces

	•	Add realistic shadows, highlights, reflections, and distortions

	•	Maintain proper perspective and proportions

	•	Organize layers in clean, clearly labeled groups

	•	Use non-destructive editing methods

	•	Revise files as needed based on feedback



?



Required Skills

	•	Advanced Adobe Photoshop skills

	•	Strong experience with Smart Objects

	•	Experience creating mockups for curved and dimensional objects

	•	Strong understanding of lighting and shadow realism

	•	Skilled in displacement maps, warping, masking, blending modes

	•	Excellent layer organization and file structuring

	•	Attention to detail

	•	Ability to follow instructions exactly



?



Deliverables



Each PSD must:

	•	Be created from scratch

	•	Include clean, organized layers and folders

	•	Have properly structured Smart Objects

	•	Be fully editable

	•	Use non-destructive editing techniques

	•	Look realistic (no obvious “pasted on” designs)

	•	Be delivered in high resolution

	•	Include complete source files



Flattened files or messy layer structures will not be accepted.



?



Compensation

	•	$1–$5 per PSD depending on complexity

	•	Higher rates for advanced mockups

	•	Ongoing work for consistent performers

	•	Opportunity to transition into a Part-Time Graphic Designer role



?



Ideal Candidate

	•	Does NOT rely on Envato or downloaded templates

	•	Understands how to build mockups from scratch

	•	Takes pride in clean, professional PSD structure

	•	Works efficiently while maintaining quality

	•	Is reliable and responsive

	•	Wants long-term remote work



?



To Apply



Please include:

	1.	Years of Photoshop experience

	2.	Portfolio of mockups you personally created from scratch

	3.	A screenshot of a layered PSD file showing your organization

	4.	Your estimated turnaround time per mockup

	5.	The word “REALISTICPSD” in your subject line



Applications without portfolios will not be reviewed.

title: Influencer Outreach Specialist
description:
We’re excited to onboard you into the Affiliate Recruiting Program.

We’re officially rolling this out next week, and we’re bringing on as many affiliates as possible (1000–2000+) in a network-style structure. The goal is to make this simple, legitimate, and rewarding for everyone involved.



How This Works

We are providing every affiliate recruiter with a proprietary lead list built using:

• automated data pipelines

• compliant lead aggregation

• behavior-based filtering

• funnel-ready segmentation

This removes the hardest part for recruiters: finding high quality affiliate leads. We’re doing that work upfront and providing you with the list of pre-vetted creators that are in our industry and highly interested in and open to collaborating

Affiliate Requirements (to get paid)

To qualify for payouts, each affiliate must:

1. Post 2 videos that clearly promotes or positively mentions the program and express intention to continue in the future

2. Affiliate link is in Creator’s profile

3. Express genuine support / positivity toward the brand (this is for legitimacy)

4. Use their unique affiliate code (generated inside our portal)

A recruitment is defined as one posted video that incorporates the brand and the affiliate joined the affiliate portal to work with us (they will be compensated in their respective portal).



Compensation

• 1.5$/hour

• Main upside: $25 per affiliate who posts 2 qualifying videos + $100 for every 10 signups

• Our recruiters that onboard 10 affiliates a day regularly earn 350$ a day. 

We want long-term relationships with our affiliates so sharing our brand values is encouraged.



Timeline

• Affiliate portal

• Official program start: 02/24/26

• Each affiliate will sign up via their affiliate URL/code portal



We’re building this so affiliates can focus on creating content while we handle:

• Affiliate onboarding

• Affiliate promotions

• The projects affiliates are working on



Benefits

Uncapped earnings — no limits on volume

We provide leads and curated prospect lists

Proven outreach scripts ready to use

Weekly meetings to strategize and hit targets

Full support of the Healsend family



We’re looking forward to working with you and expanding our affiliate network together.

title: Editor for TikTok Shop Videos
description:
Part-time Capcut / TikTok Editor with potential for more



Hiring for part-time work for a Capcut / TikTok editor



You will be making TikTok videos using Capcut.  The editing process is fairly simple and straightforward.  Anyone who is proficient in video editing should have no problem with the basic tasks such as:



Cutting dead space in talking head videos

Adding overlay images on screen in the videos

Minor effects such as dynamic zoom, cropping, etc.



Producing b-roll content from voiceover and footage provided, having the ability to digest what is being said and pair up the audio with corresponding footage



Please review a few examples of my content to ensure you are familiar and comfortable with the editing style:



Basic talking head - here you are mostly editing dead space and piecing clips together, adding minor effects like crop and zoom to make the frames look more dynamic and seamless.







Talking head with overlays - same as before, but adding images provided to you on the screen to support what is being said in the video.









You will be working hand in hand with me on an extremely viral social media page, and there is room for bonuses if deadlines are met and the content performs well!



Requirements:

Attention to detail

STRONG English

Strong internet connection

Previous experience with Capcut / TikTok / Instagram

Good working with a team

Ability to learn and take constructive feedback

Availability to work 3-4h a day (with potential for more and increased salary)

Able to work 5-6 days per week (can take days off whenever as long as you are consistent and videos are being completed)

Can take payments through Wise

PH or similar time zone



$300-$400/month + bonuses for 3-4h/day MAX, with potential for full-time work in the future and a salary increase.



To apply, please complete the recreate assignment below so I can see your skills (1h max)



Below is a Google Drive with the original files you will need to re-create with a reference video:



Google Drive: 



Talking head reference video: 



Talking head raw video Google Drive:


 



Overlay reference video: 





Overlay raw video Google Drive:


 



Please complete the following steps:



Talking Head

Download the files and import into your video editing software

Cut out all dead space between videos

Each clip should flow smoothly into the next with minimal to no pause between words

Tip: cut the clip .2-.3 seconds shorter than the end of the word said.

Do not use transitions between clips, static clips only.

Message me with a link to re-create the video



Overlay

Download the files and import into your video editing software

Cut out all dead space between videos

Each clip should flow smoothly into the next with minimal to no pause between words

Tip: cut the clip .2-.3 seconds shorter than the end of the word said.

Using the reference video and context, place overlays in the proper spots

Pay attention to overlay position and length

Make them big enough to see/read, but not so big they dominate the screen

Do not use any transitions, static overlays only



Message me a link to your re-created video where I can download it.



Please respond back to me beginning with the word “blue”; if you don´t write “blue” I will not review your application.



Looking forward to work with you!



Best of luck!

You’ll work at the intersection of data, automation, personalization, and conversion optimization—building intelligent systems that power marketing, customer experience, operations, and product discovery.



If you thrive in fast-moving environments and want real ownership inside a high-growth ecommerce brand, this role offers autonomy, impact, and the opportunity to shape the future of AI within the business.



Join a fast-paced, high-growth Australian fashion brand where creativity moves quickly and your ideas actually make it to market. We operate on local Australian hours, collaborate with a driven (and genuinely cool) team, and give you real autonomy to own your work and make bold decisions. If you thrive in an energetic environment, love cutting edge industry, and want to grow with a brand that’s scaling rapidly, this is your chance to make a real impact—not just clock in and out.

title: Affiliate Marketing and Digital Products VA (Full Time | PH Remote | US Hours)
description:
Affiliate Marketing and Digital Products VA (Full Time | PH Remote | US Hours)



ROLE SNAPSHOT:



- Compensation: $1,000 USD/ month + benefits

- Experience: VA/ Ops/ Admin/ EA (1-3 years)

- Time Zone Alignment: 9am–5pm Pacific Standard Time (Los Angeles). Please only apply if this is sustainable for you.

- Reports To: COO

- Role Type: Full-Time, Remote



ABOUT THE COMPANY

The Lovers Passport is a travel content creator page on a mission to make bucketlist adventures easy through detailed guides and content.



ABOUT THE ROLE

The Lovers Passport Generalist and Affiliate Assistant is highly organized, revenue-aware, and thrives in a fast-moving creator-led business. You are responsible for managing and optimizing all affiliate operations and digital product systems across The Lovers Passport.



This role blends operations, coordination, and execution. You’ll ensure affiliate links are accurate and optimized, digital products are organized and selling smoothly, and nothing slips through the cracks behind the scenes. You are not just “checking boxes” as your work directly impacts revenue, trust, and scalability.



You’ll serve as the internal owner of affiliate workflows and digital product operations, making sure systems are clean, updated, and running efficiently so the content and brand can scale without chaos.



Results

Affiliate systems are accurate, organized, and consistently optimized. Links work, tracking is clean, commissions are captured, and opportunities are not missed.



Digital products are well-managed and conversion-ready. Travel guides, ebooks, and downloads are up to date, properly delivered, and easy for customers to access without issues.



Revenue-driving assets never fall through the cracks. Affiliate links, landing pages, product files, and automations are reviewed regularly and maintained with care.



Affiliate income, top-performing products, and trends are tracked and reported so decisions are data-informed.



You reduce friction across the business. Creators, editors, and leadership don’t have to worry about broken links, outdated files, or missing tracking; you handle it before it becomes a problem.



You bring order to the backend. Systems feel clean, repeatable, and scalable instead of messy or reactive.



Your work directly supports growth. Better tracking, better organization, and better execution lead to higher affiliate revenue and stronger digital product sales.



Day-to-Day Duties

Affiliate Management

-Own all affiliate systems across TLP (ShopMy, LTK, Travel Payouts, Stay 22, Amazon, direct brand portals, etc.)

-Post daily M-F on ShopMy and LTK 

-Write Bi-Weekly newsletters to integrate affiliates into Passport Pals 

-Ensure affiliate links are accurate, updated, and properly tracked

-Organize affiliate links for easy access by the content team

-Monitor affiliate performance and flag top-performing products and opportunities

-Troubleshoot broken links, missing commissions, or tracking issues

-Assist with onboarding new affiliate partners and programs as needed

-Coordinate with Growth Team to Assign Creators to film/record certain voiceovers or content to promote affiliate products 



Digital Product Operations

-Create new and manage all existing digital products including travel guides, ebooks, and downloadable resources

-Ensure product files are current, properly formatted, and correctly delivered after purchase

-Maintain product libraries and backend organization

-Assist with pricing updates, product launches, and product refreshes

-Coordinate updates to sales pages, checkout flows, and
 delivery systems

-Write copy relating to digital product promotion



Systems & Organization

-Maintain clean systems across Google Drive, product folders, and internal dashboards

-Support automations and integrations (Flodesk, ManyChat, Zapier, checkout tools)

-Document processes for affiliate management and digital products to ensure repeatability

-Identify inefficiencies and suggest system improvements proactively



Reporting & Insights

-Track affiliate revenue and digital product performance on a regular basis

-Share clear summaries with leadership on wins, trends, and opportunities

-Surface issues early with proposed solutions



Tools You’ll Use

Affiliate Platforms: LTK, ShopMy, Amazon Associates, Stay 22, Travel Payouts, brand affiliate dashboards

Digital Products &
: Flodesk, ManyChat, Rexby

Project Management: Asana

Organization & Assets: Google Drive, Google Sheets, Pixieset

Design & Files: Canva

Automations: Zapier (as needed)



TRAITS & BEHAVIORS THAT MAKE YOU SUCCESSFUL HERE:



- Total ownership of deadlines and results

- Self motivator and able to work efficiently and independently

- Proactive problem prevention

- Calm, steady, and organized under moving priorities

- Direct, clear communicator

- Forward thinking. Does not wait until the last minute to complete tasks.

- Detail-oriented (catches the missing link before anyone clicks it)

- Coachable and fast-learning

- Takes pride in accuracy

- Asks for clarity before something breaks

- Closes loops without being chased

- Loves making things cleaner, simpler, and more efficient

- Suggests ways to improve systems instead of just following systems

- Willing to make mistakes and learn from them



WORKING ENVIRONMENT & EXPECTATIONS:



- Remote team, ongoing slack communication, semi-regular meetings

- Daily Slack check-ins

- Must be available for internal meetings when scheduled

- Occasional evening/weekend flexibility during launches (with advance notice)

- High standards, fast-moving environment

- High speed, reliable internet connection (20mbps or higher)

- Backup internet or data hotspot

- Webcam/ microphone for zoom needed

- Computer in working order with no issues (8GB RAM minimum preferred)

- Willing to work during US Pacific Time Hours (9am-5pm)



COMPENSATION & START:



- Compensation: $1,000 USD per month via PayPal once per month, converted to PHP at prevailing exchange rate



- Additional Compensation: 13th month pay after 6 months of continuous full-time employment (prorated), paid in December. For example, if you start in February 2026, you would be eligible for 11/12th of 1 month salary paid in December 2026. In 2027, you would be eligible for the full 12 months.



- Hours: ~40 Hours/ Week



- Start Date: Ideally within 1-2 weeks of offer or sooner



- Holidays/ Paid Time Off: PH Public Holidays Off (paid), 1 Paid Birthday Leave Day (paid), 5 Sick Days Per Calendar Year (Non-cumulative, paid, no doctor’s note required), 5 Paid Vacation Days (2+ weeks advance notice, paid. Not eligible in November.)





HOW TO APPLY

Do NOT click apply on Online Jobs



Please apply via
 to 



Please include the following in the same
:

????

s

title: Optometrist
description:
Remote Optometrist to complete charts Job Title: Remote Optometrist



Job Summary:

We are seeking a dedicated and licensed Remote Optometrist to provide virtual eye care services to patients across various locations. The role involves performing comprehensive eye exams, diagnosing vision problems, and offering advice on eyewear, contact lenses, and general eye health—all through telemedicine.



Key Responsibilities:



Conduct Virtual Eye Exams: Use telemedicine platforms to assess patients' eye health, gather medical history, and perform vision tests.



Diagnose and Treat Eye Conditions: Identify common vision issues such as nearsightedness, farsightedness, astigmatism, and presbyopia, and provide solutions.



Prescribe Eyewear & Contact Lenses: Based on exam results, issue prescriptions for glasses or contact lenses.



Monitor Patient Progress: Follow up with patients, track their vision health, and adjust prescriptions when necessary.



Provide Advice on Eye Care: Offer guidance on maintaining eye health, managing digital eye strain, and preventing common eye diseases.



Patient Education: Educate patients on how to use their prescribed eyewear properly, the importance of regular eye exams, and how to take care of their vision.



Document Patient Information: Keep accurate records of consultations, prescriptions, and any recommendations made for future care.



Collaborate with Other Healthcare Providers: Work closely with general healthcare providers and ophthalmologists when necessary for complex cases.



Required Qualifications:



Doctor of Optometry (O.D.) degree from an accredited optometry school.



State license to practice optometry (for U.S.-based positions; other country licenses may be required depending on location).



Proven experience in providing eye exams and diagnosing visual impairments.



Comfortable with using telemedicine platforms for virtual consultations.



Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain eye care concepts clearly and concisely.



Proficient in using optical diagnostic tools (e.g., autorefractor, slit lamp, etc.), even in a remote setting.



Preferred Qualifications:



Experience with remote or telehealth optometry services.



Knowledge of eye health trends and the latest in virtual care technologies.



Familiarity with prescribing digital solutions for common eye strain or other digital-related visual issues.



Work Environment:



This is a remote position, so candidates must have access to high-speed internet and a quiet, professional workspace.



Must be available for consultations during business hours or as required.



Benefits:



Competitive salary with performance-based bonuses.



Flexible working hours.



Continuing education and training in telemedicine and remote eye care.

title: Medical Patient Scheduler
description:
## Job Title: Nurse Home Visit Scheduler / Adult Foster Care (AFC) Scheduling Coordinator



## Company



**OMNISTARR** – Healthcare Staffing Agency (Massachusetts)



## Location



**Massachusetts (Remote/Hybrid as applicable)**





## Employment Type



Full-time (or Part-time, depending on business need)



---



## Position Summary



OMNISTARR is seeking a highly organized and patient-focused **Nurse Home Visit Scheduler** to coordinate and schedule **in-home nursing visits** for members enrolled in Massachusetts **Adult Foster Care (AFC)** programs. In this role, you will contact the **caregiver and/or member**, confirm availability, and **schedule required nursing visits in the system** while ensuring timely completion and compliance with MassHealth program expectations (including required visit cadence and admission timelines). ([Massachusetts Government][1])



This position is ideal for someone who is confident on the phone, detail-oriented, comfortable working with sensitive health information, and experienced with scheduling in a fast-paced healthcare environment.



---



## Key Responsibilities



### Scheduling & Coordination



* Schedule **RN/LPN in-home visits** for AFC members across Massachusetts, coordinating directly with **caregivers** to identify appropriate dates/times and confirm the visit location.

* Ensure **required nursing visits** are scheduled on time—commonly **every other month onsite** (or more frequently if clinically necessary), coordinated to alternate with care management visits so members receive a monthly touchpoint as applicable. ([Massachusetts Government][1])

* Coordinate **admission/initial visit scheduling**, helping ensure nursing participation is completed within required timeframes when applicable. ([Massachusetts Government][1])

* Communicate scheduled visit details to field nurses (address, caregiver contact, member notes needed for the visit, special instructions such as parking/access, pets, language needs).



### Caregiver/Member Communication



* Call caregivers/members professionally and compassionately to:



  * confirm availability and best contact method

  * verify address and visit readiness (home access, safety considerations)

  * provide appointment reminders and reduce no-shows

* Handle cancellations/reschedules quickly while maintaining compliance with visit requirements.

* Escalate urgent concerns reported by caregivers/members (e.g., clinical changes, safety issues, missed medications) to the clinical team per OMNISTARR protocol.



### Documentation & System Updates



* Enter and maintain accurate scheduling information in the designated scheduling platform/system (appointments, reschedules, notes, confirmations).

* Maintain clean, audit-ready scheduling records that align with program and internal documentation expectations (including supporting workflows tied to required visits). ([Massachusetts Government][2])

* Support visit tracking and operational reporting (scheduled vs. completed visits, missed visits, nurse coverage needs, upcoming due visits).



### Collaboration & Coverage Management



* Coordinate with OMNISTARR nursing staff and AFC agency partners to manage territories, nurse availability, and coverage gaps.

* Support the multidisciplinary nature of AFC services by communicating effectively with clinical staff and care management partners as needed. ([Massachusetts Government][3])

* Assist with schedule optimization to reduce travel burden and improve consistency for members/caregivers.



### Compliance & Confidentiality



* Handle Protected Health Information (PHI) in accordance with **HIPAA** and OMNISTARR policies.

* Follow MassHealth/AFC guidance and internal SOPs when scheduling, documenting, and communicating member-related information. ([Massachusetts Government][4])



---



## Required Qualifications



* High school diploma or equivalent (Associate’s degree preferred).

* 1+ year experience in **healthcare scheduling**, coordination, call center patient scheduling, home health operations, or similar role.

* Strong phone communication skills and professional etiquette (comfortable calling caregivers daily).

* Strong attention to detail and ability to manage high volume scheduling with accuracy.

* Comfort using scheduling software, EHR/EMR systems, Microsoft Office/Google Workspace.

* Ability to maintain confidentiality and work with sensitive health-related information.



---



## Preferred Qualifications



* Experience supporting **home health**, **community-based services**, **long-term services and supports (LTSS)**, or **MassHealth** populations.

* Familiarity with Massachusetts **Adult Foster Care (AFC)** or related programs. ([Massachusetts Government][4])

* Bilingual skills (Spanish, Portuguese, Haitian Creole, etc.) strongly preferred.

* Experience coordinating field staff schedules across multiple territories.



---



## Key Skills & Competencies



* Excellent organization, time management, and follow-through

* Calm, empathetic communication style with caregivers and families

* Problem-solving mindset (last-minute changes, coverage gaps, urgent reschedules)

* Ability to prioritize due/overdue visits and manage competing deadlines

* Team-oriented and dependable



---



## About OMNISTARR



**OMNISTARR is a healthcare staffing agency** that supports Massachusetts healthcare providers by recruiting and placing qualified clinicians—including nurses who conduct **in-home visits** for Adult Foster Care agencies across the state. OMNISTARR partners with care teams to help ensure members receive timely nursing oversight in the community. ([Home Care Alliance of Massachusetts][5])



**Adult Foster Care (AFC)** is a MassHealth-funded program in Massachusetts that supports eligible adults who live with a caregiver in a qualified home setting and receive assistance with daily living needs, along with clinical oversight and care management. ([Massachusetts Government][4])



---

title: Duda Website Expert Wanted (Real Operator Only) | Full-Time
description:
???? No Portfolio. No Resume. No “Websites You Built.”

Duda Website Expert Wanted (Real Operator Only) | Full-Time



We are not hiring off screenshots.

We are not reviewing portfolios.

We are not impressed by links you claim you built.



Last time we hired for Duda, almost every applicant showed us websites they did not actually build.



So we are doing this differently.



We judge skill in real time.



? Required to Apply: Loom Proof (Must Be You)



To apply, you must send a Loom video showing it is actually you operating inside Duda.



In your Loom, do this in one recording:



Log into your Duda account



Open any site (new or existing)



Build a simple layout live (do not overthink it)



add 2–3 sections



adjust spacing + typography



show mobile edits



Add a Custom HTML section



drop in a basic HTML block (simple structure is fine)



add an H1 inside the HTML and style it



then explain what you expect Duda to do with that HTML and styling after it’s saved/published



This is not about perfection. It’s about proving you actually know Duda and how it behaves with custom code.



No Loom = not considered.



?? Quick Knowledge Check (Answer In Your Message)



In 3–6 sentences, answer:



What holds Duda back compared to other builders?



Is Duda strong for SEO, and why?



What happens when you add raw HTML into a Duda section?



Keep it simple and direct.



???? Live Build Test (Final Interview)



If your Loom looks legit, we will do a live test.



We will give you content and direction and you will build a page with 3 sections inside Duda. If you are truly skilled, this should take less than 20 minutes.



Full-Time Role



This is a full-time position for a real Duda operator. Pay depends on skill level and execution.

description:
E-Commerce AI Video Editor — Full-Time / Remote



We're an e-commerce brand looking for an AI-forward video editor who can produce content that holds attention and drives conversions.



What We Need



Someone who edits for watch time and retention. You understand pacing, hooks, and why people keep watching. You're comfortable using AI tools to work fast: HeyGen, Higgsfield, Kling, Veo 3, Seedance, Nano Banana Pro, Fish Audio, or ElevenLabs. Vmake experience is a bonus.



You can work across multiple formats — VSLs, UGC mashups, hook variations — and you understand what makes each one work differently. You edit for retention and conversions, not just to make something look good.

title: Project Manager & Quality Assurance Lead
description:
Role: Operations & Quality Assurance (QA) Lead

Compensation: $1,500 USD/Month ($1,200 Base + $300 KPI-Based Bonus)

Structure: Full-Time, Remote



We are a leading Shopify SEO & CRO agency seeking an Operations Manager & QA Lead for our CRO department to serve as the final point of accountability for all client deliverables, essentially our "Quality Firewall".



Your mission is simple: Zero Errors. You will sit between the production team (Design/Dev) and the Strategy/Client layer. You are responsible for ensuring every deliverable is 100% polished, on-time, and strategically sound. If a mistake reaches the client, it is your responsibility.



The Candidate Profile



We aren't looking for a "generalist." We are looking for an A-Player who sits at the intersection of these three specific domains:



1. The PM Stack (Operations & Accountability)



The Goal: 100% On-time delivery.

The Skill: You have experience (preferably 2-3+ years) managing technical or creative teams. You are great at resource allocation, managing team velocity, and maintaining project management suites. You don't just "check in"; you drive the timeline.



2. The QA Stack (Technical Precision)



The Goal: Zero defects.

The Skill: You are extremely detail-oriented. You notice the misalignments, logic flaws, or broken elements on a website that everyone else misses. Preferably, you also have an understanding of the technical logic behind what's happening on the website.



3. The Leadership Stack (High Agency & Communication)



The Goal: Strategic focus for the leadership.

The Skill: You are comfortable being the "bad guy" when standards aren't met. You value "Closing the Loop"; if an error occurs, you update the SOP so it never happens again. You are a professional, direct communicator who can proactively communicate with clients.



The Mindset



High Agency: You don't wait for permission to fix a broken process.

Intolerance of Mediocrity: You prioritize the end result.



Application Instructions



To apply, submit your CV, your motivations for applying, and a brief overview of your relevant experience.



Additionally, provide your tactical response to the following three scenarios:



1. It’s Friday, 4:00 PM. A developer tells you a critical Shopify landing page build will be "mostly ready" by EOD, but they need Monday morning to "clean up some minor mobile responsiveness issues." The client expects the launch on Monday at 9:00 AM. 



2. Our lead designer is brilliant, but consistently forgets to update changes across all pages in a project. You’ve mentioned it twice. Today, you found the same error again on a high-stakes project.



3. A client messages you directly on a Friday evening asking for a "small change" after designs are approved and development is underway. You aren't sure if this aligns with the original strategy.



How do you handle each of these situations?



Looking forward to hearing from you.

title: Personal Loan Assessor – Australian Experience Required
description:
Personal Loan Assessor – Australian Experience Required (Remote – Philippines Team)



We are an Australian-licensed fintech lender seeking an experienced Personal Loan Assessor with direct experience assessing Australian consumer loan applications.



This role is critical in supporting our growing loan volumes while maintaining strict compliance with Australian responsible lending laws.



We are specifically looking for someone who has worked within Australian lending frameworks and understands NCCP obligations, affordability assessments, and loan verification standards.



About the Role



You will be responsible for reviewing customer applications, verifying supporting documents, and assessing suitability in line with:



- National Consumer Credit Protection Act (NCCP)



- Responsible Lending obligations



- Internal credit and affordability policies



- Target Market Determinations (TMDs)



You must be confident assessing:



PAYG income verification



Bank statements (90-day review minimum)



Living expenses and liabilities



Credit reports (Equifax / Illion / Experian)



Serviceability calculations



Hardship indicators and red flags



Requirements



Prior experience assessing Australian personal loan applications



Strong understanding of responsible lending obligations



Experience reviewing Australian bank statements and credit reports



Excellent attention to detail



Clear written and spoken English



Reliable high-speed internet



Secure and private home workspace



Ability to document assessments clearly for audit and compliance purposes



Highly Desirable



When applying, please outline:



Which Australian lending platforms you have used and whether you have worked with:



- Automated decision engines



- Manual credit assessments



- Loan management systems (LMS)



Whether you have access to or can provide:



- Assessment manuals



- Process documentation



- SOPs used in prior Australian lending roles



- QA or compliance checklists



- Experience helping set up or manage offshore assessment teams.



- Your experience handling hardship, complaints, or vulnerable customers.



We are specifically building a Philippines-based assessment team to manage increased loan volume while maintaining Australian compliance standards. If you have experience helping structure offshore teams or implementing assessment processes, please highlight this.



What We’re Looking For:



We are not simply hiring a processor.



We are looking for someone who:



Understands Australian lending compliance deeply.



Can follow structured assessment guidelines.



Can help us build scalable, documented processes.



Thinks critically about borrower suitability.



Flags potential responsible lending risks.



How to Apply



Please submit:



Your resume (highlighting Australian loan assessment experience).



A brief overview of:



Platforms you have used.



Your experience with Australian compliance.



Whether you have access to manuals or SOPs from previous roles.



Your availability and expected salary (AUD or PHP).



Only applicants with direct Australian lending experience will be considered.

title: AI ECOM Creative Strategist & Scriptwriter
description:
We're an e-commerce brand in the book niche looking for a creative strategist who can own our ad output from concept to final cut.



What You'll Do



You'll lead a pod of 2 video editors. You write the briefs and scripts, hand them directly to your editors, and see the creative through to completion — including managing revisions and ensuring the final ad matches the vision. You're the bridge between strategy and execution.



You understand direct response. Stages of awareness, problem agitation, mass desires — you apply these naturally when building angles and scripts. You know how to research winning ads, spot what's working, and turn that into clear, actionable briefs your editors can execute without confusion.



You write scripts with Claude, know how to prompt it effectively, and are familiar with AI tools like Higgsfield, Nano Banana Pro, and Kling — enough to brief confidently and know what's possible.



We provide full training, brief templates, and creative direction. You build on that and own the output.



The Output



5-6 unique briefs and scripts delivered every day. You manage the full creative cycle — research, brief, editor handoff, revisions, final delivery.



Pay



$1,750/month + cash bonuses for every winning ad that scales.



To Apply



Start your message with "BRIEF" and include:



- Examples of scripts or creative briefs you've written

- How you approach ad research and finding winning creatives

- Tools you use (Claude, ad spy tools, AI platforms, etc.)

title: Building & Construction Estimator
description:
Building & Construction Estimator – Independent Contractor (Remote)



We are an Australian building and property maintenance company seeking an experienced Building and Construction Estimator to provide remote estimating and job coordination support. This is an independent contractor role only and is not employment.



The role involves preparing estimates and take-offs from plans, photos, and scopes of work; managing and updating jobs in ServiceM8 (SM8) and Simpro; tracking costs, variations, and progress; assisting with contract administration; and liaising with clients, subcontractors, and our in-house bookkeeper. Experience with AutoCAD or similar drafting software is advantageous.



Applicants must have proven construction estimating experience, strong knowledge of building maintenance and small construction works, and hands-on experience using both Simpro and ServiceM8 (SM8). Formal qualifications in building construction are preferred. Strong written English, attention to detail, reliability, and the ability to work independently are essential. Reliable internet access is required.



Engagement is remote and task-based, paid at an agreed hourly or per-task rate (AUD). Contractors are responsible for their own tax, superannuation, insurance, equipment, and working arrangements. Availability during Australian business hours is preferred but flexible. Ongoing work may be offered following a short paid trial task.



To apply, please provide a brief summary of your experience, confirm Simpro and ServiceM8 experience, state your availability, and advise your preferred rate.

title: YouTube Long-Form Producer (Twitch VOD into 1 High-Quality Video / Week)
description:
Kamusta.



I’m a Filipino Canadian creator looking for one sharp, independent editor to become my long-form YouTube producer.



This is not a clip-cutting job.

This is not highlight reels or 
 edits.



You will take full 2–4 hour Twitch VODs and shape them into one strong, structured 8–15 minute YouTube video each week.



My content is calm, conversational, and idea-driven; focused on mindset, personal growth, community conversations, lessons learned, and navigating life honestly. The goal is clarity, retention, and strong narrative structure — not flashy effects.



This role is closer to a YouTube producer than a basic editor.



-----



Weekly Workflow:

• Watch a full VOD (2–4 hours)

• Identify one strong theme, struggle, or lesson worth expanding

• Send 2–3 timestamps + a 1-sentence hook for approval

• Edit a tight 8–15 minute long-form video

• Remove unnecessary dead air while preserving natural tone

• Shape pacing and structure for retention

• Create a clean, CTR-focused thumbnail

• Deliver via Drive (max 2 revision rounds)



Target: 1 high-quality video per week.



As trust builds and workflow tightens, video frequency can increase.



-----



What I’m Looking For:

• Experience editing long-form YouTube content (send links)

• Strong understanding of hooks and retention psychology

• Ability to commit to one clear thesis per video

• Someone who understands conversational content — not over-edited

• Good English reading comprehension

• Reliable internet + ability to work async

• Tools: Premiere Pro or DaVinci Resolve; Canva or Photoshop



Bonus if you understand livestream culture and community-driven content.



-----



What This Is NOT:

• Not short-form repurposing

• Not subtitle-heavy editing

• Not fast-turnaround quantity work

• Not effect-heavy montage style



Judgment and taste matter more than transitions.



-----



Pay:

• $50–75 CAD per long-form video (depending on experience and trial quality)

• 1 video per week to start

• Increased frequency available as consistency and autonomy are proven

• Paid trial video

• Performance bonuses for strong CTR & retention

• Long-term rate increases with results



I’m looking for a long-term collaboration, not short-term rotation.



-----



How to Apply:

– Send 2–3 long-form YouTube videos you’ve edited.

– In 2–3 sentences, explain what makes a calm, conversational video retain viewers.

– One sentence: Why are you the best fit for this role?



If your work and answers stand out, I will move you to a pre-screening stage, where you’ll receive a real Twitch VOD and be tested on your ability to create a strong thematic narrative suitable for YT videos.



Salamat, usap tayo.



Chris

title: Creative Execution & Brand Delivery Assistant (Design Studio)
description:
Kamusta!!

We are a boutique design studio led by a Filipina founder who built the business through heart, taste, and genuine care for her clients.



This is not a corporate agency.

This is a growing, family-led studio.



Clients work with us because they trust the founder’s creative direction, communication, and integrity. As the studio grows, we are looking for someone to join us long-term and become part of the team behind the scenes.



We offer services including:

• Branding & Rebrands

• Packaging Design

• Web Design

• Social Media Systems

• Brand Strategy

• Illustration & Visual Assets

• Creative Direction



The founder leads all client communication and high-level creative decisions.



We are hiring a Creative Execution & Delivery Assistant whose role is to take already-started projects and bring them to completion — clean, polished, and ready for handoff.



You will not be starting concepts from scratch.

You will be refining, expanding, and preparing approved work.



Your role includes:



Refining & Completing Design Work

• Expanding approved logos into full logo systems

• Polishing typography, spacing, and layout

• Applying branding to packaging dielines

• Preparing web assets for developer handoff

• Creating social templates from approved brand systems

• Finalizing illustrations or supporting graphics based on direction



Preparing Production-Ready Files

• Setting up packaging files with proper bleed and CMYK

• Exporting complete logo packages (AI, EPS, SVG, PNG, JPG, PDF)

• Preparing optimized web and social assets

• Organizing website imagery and brand files



Organizing & Packaging Final Deliverables

• Cleaning and organizing working files

• Following clear naming conventions

• Building structured folder systems

• Creating simple brand guideline PDFs from templates

• Preparing professional delivery folders for clients



You will NOT:

• Speak directly with clients

• Join discovery calls

• Lead creative strategy

• Override creative direction



You will be trusted to take projects from 80% to 100%.



We are looking for someone who:

• Is strong in Adobe Illustrator (required)

• Understands packaging and basic print production

• Has strong attention to detail

• Can follow direction precisely

• Takes pride in clean files and organized systems

• Is looking for a stable, respectful, long-term working relationship



This is a family-led business.

We value loyalty, consistency, and mutual respect.

If you grow with us, there is long-term opportunity.



To apply, include:

1. The word “Precision” at the top of your application

2. A short explanation of how you would prepare a logo package for delivery

3. A link to relevant portfolio work

4. Your internet speed



Salamat!!

title: Healthcare Virtual Assistant HIPAA Certified
description:
Integrative & Holistic Medical Practice – Long-Term Position



We are a busy, physician-led integrative and regenerative medical practice based in Maryland, USA. We specialize in complex chronic illness, hormone optimization, regenerative medicine, Lyme disease, integrative oncology, and aesthetic medicine.



We are seeking a highly organized, reliable, and professional Healthcare Virtual Assistant for a long-term position. This is not a temporary job. We are looking for someone who wants stability, growth, and responsibility.



You must have prior experience working in a medical setting and understand confidentiality, professionalism, and urgency in patient care.



REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS



* HIPAA Certified (Required – must provide proof)

* Prior experience working for a U.S.-based medical clinic

* Excellent spoken and written English

* Comfortable speaking with patients by phone

* Quiet home office, stable internet, and backup power

* Available during U.S. Eastern Time business hours

* Professional demeanor with patients

* High attention to detail

* Strong follow-through (nothing falls through the cracks)



CORE RESPONSIBILITIES



Patient Communication



* Answer incoming calls professionally

* Make outbound follow-up calls

* Schedule new and follow-up appointments

* Confirm appointments

* Reschedule and manage cancellations

* Collect complete patient information

* Send intake forms and instructions

* Handle patient questions using provided scripts



Scheduling & Calendar Management



* Manage physician calendar efficiently

* Avoid double-booking

* Prioritize urgent cases appropriately

* Ensure proper appointment type selection (initial, follow-up, telemedicine, etc.)



Prescription Refills



* Process refill requests

* Communicate refill approvals or denials

* Coordinate with pharmacies

* Track refill documentation in EHR

* Escalate medication questions appropriately



Medical Documentation Support



* Organize patient charts

* Upload labs and imaging

* Track pending lab results

* Prepare charts before appointments

* Ensure documentation completeness



Administrative Tasks



* Verify patient contact information

* Manage
s professionally

* Maintain organized digital records

* Track incomplete tasks and follow up

* Assist with billing coordination (basic support only)



SOFTWARE EXPERIENCE (Preferred)



* EHR/EMR systems (experience required; specific system training provided)

* Google Workspace

* Zoom / Telehealth platforms

* CRM or scheduling software

* Ability to learn new systems quickly



PERSONALITY TRAITS WE VALUE



* Calm under pressure

* Organized and structured

* Direct communicator

* Respectful and compassionate with patients

* Takes initiative

* Loyal and long-term minded

* Not easily overwhelmed



POSITION DETAILS



* Part-time or full-time (to be discussed)

* Paid training period

* Performance-based raises

* Long-term opportunity

* Opportunity to grow into leadership role



IMPORTANT: HOW TO APPLY



To be considered, you must:



1. Include the word **DRBLOEM** in the subject line.

2. Provide proof of HIPAA certification.

3. Send a short voice recording introducing yourself.

4. List your previous medical experience.

5. State your hourly rate and available hours per week.



Applications without these steps will not be reviewed.



We are building something meaningful. We help patients who have often been dismissed elsewhere. If you take pride in being organized, dependable, and serving patients with excellence, we would love to hear from you.



Serious applicants only.

title: Client Success & General Support Coordinator
description:
Remote | US Business Hours | Part Time



We are a growing digital marketing company seeking a reliable Client Success and Operations Coordinator to help manage client communication and support internal workflows. This role is part time to start and focused on maintaining strong, proactive relationships with clients while keeping projects organized behind the scenes.



You will respond to client messages during your scheduled US business hour window, clarify requests, manage expectations, and ensure nothing slips through the cracks. Internally, you will track tasks, follow up with tea
mbers, document updates, and help improve processes when gaps appear. This is not just a support role. You are expected to think independently, stay organized, and communicate clearly.



Because leadership operates in a different time zone, you must be comfortable working autonomously and providing structured end of shift summaries outlining conversations, open items, and next steps. Experience in digital marketing is required, including familiarity with services such as paid ads, SEO, websites, and funnels at a conversational level.



This position begins at approximately 20 to 25 hours per week during US business hours. Compensation is $3 to $4 per hour based on experience, with opportunity to grow into a larger role as the company scales.

title: Implementation Manager
description:
Full-Time Implementation Manager / Tech Builder (
 + Skool)



Who I Am (The Architect):



Our aim is to run an education business for information product owners, serving "Whale" clients (High Net Worth Individuals).



I’ll take the role of the Visionary and the Architect. 

My job is to generate ideas, strategies, write copy, and coach clients. 

My mind moves fast, and my design says: "I see this, make it happen."





Who You Are (The Engineer + Builder):



Your role is the Engineer/Implementation Partner who says: "I see it, I know how to get it done, and I’ll get it done."

You love being in the trenches, connecting the tech, and launching fast.

(Note: During our first few weeks together, we'll build our dynamic by going hand-in-hand so you learn exactly how I operate).

Funnel Building (

 & CRM Automation (

, Social Media, IG Stories, etc.)

title: Short-Form Video Editor – Documentary / Human-Centered Content
description:
PLEASE READ THIS PAGE THOROUGHLY — YOU CAN FIND THE EDITING APPLICATION FORM AT THE BOTTOM



We are looking for an editor with experience in live event, retreat, workshop, or community-based content. This is not a fast-cut, trend-based editing role.



About Us:



Spirit Soul hosts live Kirtan gatherings around the world. Kirtan is a guided group chanting experience rooted in Yoga Sound Meditation. People come together to sing, reflect, meditate, and connect.



Our focus is simple: create a space where people feel calmer, more open, and more connected.



We are not influencers. We are not motivational speakers. We are not a high-energy brand. Everything we create should reflect that.



Project Overview:



We are looking for a video editor who understands documentary-style, human storytelling.



We are creating:



* 30–60 second Kirtan Experience trailers

* Invitation videos for upcoming events

* Tour teasers

* Event recap videos

* Ongoing short-form content for social media



The purpose of these videos is to:



1. Show what Kirtan actually feels like.

2. Help people feel comfortable attending.

3. Capture the real atmosphere of the event.



This is not fast-paced social media editing.

This is not YouTube essay-style editing.

This is not high-energy marketing content.



It should feel natural, grounded, and real.



Watch this video to get an idea: 



Your Role:



You will:



* Edit live event footage into 30–60 second trailers

* Create short documentary-style recaps

* Maintain natural pacing

* Use clean, minimal subtitles

* Apply warm, natural color grading

* Preserve real audio from the space (chanting, laughter, room ambience)



You should know how to:



* Build a simple emotional arc

* Let 
nts breathe

* Avoid over-editing

* Avoid trendy transitions or effects



We care more about tone and pacing than flashy skills.



You’re a Good Fit If:



* You have strong experience in Premiere Pro.

* You’ve edited documentary-style content, retreats, live events, or community-based content.

* You understand natural pacing (not rapid cuts every 1–2 seconds).

* You are comfortable working with real event footage.

* You avoid overusing motion graphics and effects.

* You care about subtle sound design and natural ambience.

* You communicate clearly and take feedback well.



Editing Style We’re Looking For:



What this is:



* Documentary-style

* Observational

* Natural pacing

* Emotion driven by real 
nts

* Minimal graphics

* Clean subtitles

* Warm, natural color



What this is not:



* Alex Hormozi style

* High-retention hook editing

* Loud motivational pacing

* Heavy zooms, glitch effects, or dramatic transitions

* Over-designed YouTube essays



If the edit feels like an ad, it’s wrong.

If it feels like a real memory, it’s right.



Sound:



Natural audio matters.



We want:



* Real chanting

* Room ambience

* Breath

* Laughter

* Crowd energy



Music should support gently, not dominate.

No dramatic trailer builds.

No cinematic booms.



Compensation:



Paid per project at first.



After a successful trial period, there is opportunity for consistent ongoing work.



Hiring Process:



1. Submit your application via the form below.

2. If aligned, we will reach out via
.

3. You will complete a short paid trial edit (approx. 60–70 seconds).

4. If your pacing and tone match what we’re looking for, we move forward.



Editing Application Form:



If interested, please apply here:

title: Next.js/React Developer with AI Expertise
description:
About Us:

If you are looking for a mundane, punch-the-clock coding job, please skip this post. We are looking for pure passion. We are a fast-moving, 3-founder startup (current YC Spring applicants) building an ambitious AI-driven visibility and optimization platform. We are leaving traditional, clunky data dashboards in the past and building an intuitive, blazing-fast, "Apple-level" expert workspace. This is not just a gig—we are looking for a long-term tea
mber who will grow with us, push the limits of what is possible, and build the best possible user experiences in today's world.   



We do not care about your age, your years of corporate experience, or your formal degrees. We care about your slope. If you are a young, hungry, self-taught developer with an insane portfolio, an eye for Apple-level design, and the drive to build something world-class, we want you.



The Role:

We are looking for a highly skilled Next.js/React Developer who has a deep appreciation for world-class UI/UX and a burning desire to create something truly incredible. You will not be building from scratch entirely—we heavily utilize AI coding assistants (Claude/Cursor) to move fast. Your job is to act as the pilot: refining the code, connecting complex proprietary data pipelines, and ensuring the front-end experience is slick, tasteful, and flawless.   



Tech Stack:   



Next.js (App Router) & React (TypeScript)   



Vercel Hosting & Supabase Backend  



Experience handling heavy, real-time API integrations   



What You Will Do:   



Take our current application and elevate it to a premium, intuitive workspace.   



Ensure data rendering is extremely fast and intuitive (reducing manual data entry wherever AI can predict it).   



Seamlessly integrate our external enterprise data pipelines into the front end.   



Work directly with the CEO and CTO to finalize the product for our YC interview and launch.   



Requirements:   



Strong portfolio showcasing highly polished, modern UI/UX (Tailwind, Framer Motion, etc.).   



Deep understanding of Next.js App Router and state management.   



Deep experience accelerating development with AI. We are heavy users of Claude Code and Cursor, and we expect you to leverage these tools alongside our team to push the absolute limits of frontend engineering.



Note: This is strictly an engineering role. You will not be doing general VA tasks.

title: Entry-Level Cold Caller / Opener / Lead Generator – No Experience Needed!
description:
Position: Remote Cold Caller / Opener / Lead Generator – Start Your Sales Career Today

Company: Catalyst– Fast-Growing Marketing & Funding Company (US-based)

Location: 100% Remote (Philippines – perfect for home-based workers)

Type: Full-Time or Part-Time ( flexible shifts to match US hours)

Pay Structure (Real Earnings Potential):



Base Pay: $1.00 per hour (steady while you learn)

App Bonus: $2.00–$3.00 per qualified booked appointment (your main money-maker!)

Funding Bonus: Extra cash bonuses when your leads close and get funded (top performers add hundreds or even $1,000s/month)



What This Job Is About

No cold calling experience? No problem! We're a dynamic marketing and funding company. You'll be our frontline opener: dialing individuals who might need fast funding for inventory, payroll, marketing, or growth. Use our proven scripts, overcome simple objections, qualify them quickly, and book them for our expert closers. It's high-volume outbound calling — the more you dial and book, the more you earn!

This is perfect if you're:



New to sales but willing to learn and grind

A fast learner with good English and a positive attitude

Looking to build real sales skills in finance/marketing

Motivated by bonuses (many of our team started at entry-level and now earn big!)



Your Daily Wins



Make outbound cold calls (100–200+ per shift) using our easy dialer system

Follow simple scripts to pitch MCA cash advances and credit lines

Chat with business owners (restaurants, shops, contractors, online sellers, etc.)

Ask quick questions to qualify (revenue, needs, etc.)

Book qualified appointments/transfers for our funding team

Log calls and results

Hit fun daily targets to unlock bonuses



Requirements – Super Beginner-Friendly



No experience necessary – we'll train you step-by-step!

Clear English speaking (phone-friendly accent is great)

Reliable high-speed internet, quiet workspace, headset, and laptop/PC

Positive mindset — rejection is normal, persistence wins here

Available for US time zone shifts (e.g., PH morning/evening overlap with EST/PST)

Honest, hardworking, and excited to earn more through performance



Why You'll Love It Here



No experience? No issue — we hire attitude over resume

Work from home in your PJs — total freedom

Weekly or bi-weekly payouts so you see money fast

Uncapped bonuses — hustle hard and your paycheck grows fast

Real career path: Start as a cold caller ? become an opener ? move to closer roles

Supportive team with scripts, training calls, and tips from pros

Help US businesses grow while building your own income



Ready to start dialing and stacking bonuses? Apply today!

Send your resume (or just tell us about yourself), a quick 20–30 second voice recording introducing yourself, and why you're excited about sales/funding.
 to [your hiring
] or apply via [link/DM].

Let's get you booked and paid — spots fill up quick for motivated starters!

title: Reels & TikTok Retention Focused Video Editor
description:
Hiring: Reel + TikTok Video Editor (Educational Skincare Brand)

I am growing an educational skincare page focused on retinol, barrier repair, and intentional routines.



I’m looking for a creative editor who understands retention, clean pacing, and authority-style content  not just trends and fast transitions.



Tone: calm, clinical, premium.

Style: minimalist, structured, educational.



Responsibilities:



• Edit Instagram Reels and TikTok videos

• Help create strong, scroll stopping hooks

• Structure content for retention (especially first 3 seconds)
